title: Fantastic hotel, stellar service
text: The Hotel Chelsea is an absolute gem. Skillfully updated very recently, yet they've managed to preserve the history and quirkiness in a completely sophisticated manner. The staff is uniformly excellent--helpful, polite, and efficient. The rooms--ah, the rooms! The two bedroom pied-a-terre is breathtaking and wonderfully appointed. The Lobby Bar is fantastic--great craft cocktails. The Cafe Chelsea is charming and the food is delicious. Despite being very crowded, the service was top notch. We have stayed in at least 10 other hotels all over NYC (including The Plaza) and The Hotel Chelsea is the only one we are sure to revisit!

title: Xmas vacation
text:
We came to NYC for Xmas holiday and stayed at hotel Chelsea because it’s a little far from the crowd . We were amazed with this hotel , location , staff, decor and everything . We have a 4 year old and the staff provided us with an additional bed and they were vey very nice and welcoming . The room is spacious and lots of additional closet space and bathroom is big . It was very quiet as well . The room is also clean and staff always
Made sure of that !  Very close to subway station . We loved it !!!

title: The Best.
text: My 3rd stay since the renovations. Each stay tops the last. The attention to detail, respect for the original structure and history of the hotel are evident. The staff are wonderful and seem to share the same appreciation. This is a special place with a special kind of charm. Great neighborhood and location. Subway 1 block away but centrally located easy walk to Downtown, Chelsea Galleries, Greenwich Village, MSG/Penn Station.

title: Our New Favorite - will always stay here
text:
Rooms and renovation are beautiful without losing the charm and bohemian vibe .  Linens , furnishings , staff , food and drink options all first class .  In Midtown in no time 
but come  back and relax in Chelsea .  Had a balcony room , next time will get one with bath tub .  Can't say enough great things !

title: Amazing stay
text:
Super atmosphere.  Friendly staff.  Location was great to walk to so many neighbourhoods and great restaurants.  Cafe was delicious and cozy atmosphere - we were repeat guests.  Hotel is charming and the rooms are large and comfortable. 
Large bathroom for New York hotel.  Would definitely come back and stay here again.

title: Rock & Roll all Grown Up
text:
Hip• Sexy•Swanky•Classic
Checked into the hotel late after a long flight and was greeted with the warmest welcome.  Joanna at the front desk made sure that our stay would be delightful. We were in our lovely room within minutes and having drinks and appetizers at the fabulous Lobby Bar shortly thereafter.
The energy is real- a vibe born from decades of the artists that graced this super sexy landmark. 
It’s a must stay!!!!

title: Most charming.
text: I have never been to a hotel with such charming rooms. The staff was courteous and friendly. It was a great experience. As a former New Yorker I appreciated the history of the hotel that housed so many artists, many of which became famous.  The Hotel Chelsea will be my choice stay whenever I visit the city.

title: Vibes !!!
text: The renovation of the legendary Hotel Chelsea is incredible . you can feel the vibes of creativity there . All of the attention to details are spot on. In a great Neighborhood ! Highly recommend it . tons of art in the hotel and in the Chelsea neighborhood . all in walking distance

title: Stunning and comfy
text: This place is awesome. My husband and I were visiting to see an off-broadway noir-themed production and I wanted the place we stayed to continue that mysterious, alluring vibe. It worked out beautifully. The desk and door staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was stunning and comfortable (clean, of course). We had an interior room (which was nice and quiet) with a bay window. There are several complementary items available upon request. I asked for a yoga mat, scale, loofa and white-noise machine, all which appeared within 20 minutes. Check-in and out can be done online so all you do is grab or return the old-school room key. We're going back again in April and are staying here again. It's pricey, but totally worth it for a more romantic feeling stay.

title: Always a great time at The Hotel Chelsea!
text: The Hotel Chelsea is the best iconic place to stay in Manhattan. So beautiful, the art and the history and the people, always brings me back. Everything and everyone was excellent. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The room was beautiful, clean and I had a balcony view. I highly recommend the Hotel Spa, Cafe and the Lobby Bar. It’s always a fun time! Thanks, I’ll be back! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: The BEST IN NYC!
text: We really enjoyed staying at the Hotel Chelsea. They upgraded our room on their own, with no prompting, only a great attention to the customer. Then, they gave my husband a bottle of wine for his birthday. We have stayed at dozens of nice hotels over the past twenty years, but we have never been treated with such respectfulness and attentiveness. With other places, we often felt that they were maybe nice until you have any sort of problem or need. This place made us feel so supremely respected, something that sets the standard for all hoteliers everywhere. We only wish we had a way to thank the staff at the front desk. They were always eager to treat the guest with utmost consideration. Joanna, at the front desk on March 7th, was so genuine and so nice to us. Everyone was nice and professional. Our room was well maintained throughout our stay. We will definitely return. We highly recommend this fine NYC hotel!

title: Magnificent! A must stay
text:
Magnificent! The service, staff, amenities, location is fabulous. Luxury bedding and decor, we have selected this hotel as our go to. 
Cafe Chelsea is also something not to miss. Also, the spa is now open and they are amazing! 
We have always had superb and seamless service from the reception to room service.

title: A WONDERFUL HOME IN NYC
text:
Is a wonderful remake of what the HOTEL CHELSEA is and was. I love the way it has been remade in all its quirks and wonder. SPA is now open. GYM is now open.  All is well at HOTEL CHELSEA I can report. 

Having lived in NYC for 30 years, the HOTEL CHELSEA is the home away from home now for work, play and exploring NYC in 2024.

title: Wonderful time, can’t wait to come back!
text: My husband and I stayed here in late February and it was wonderful. The hotel is lovely and the staff are so friendly and helpful. Our room was awesome and the huge bathtub was worth it. Can’t wait to come back! Ps visit the lobby bar, the cocktails are great.

title: Great stay in February
text: Comfortable and clean, friendly and good vibes at the front desk. Enjoyed our stay of 2 nights and would happily return. Cafe and bar are terrific. Loved the art on the stairway walls. Expensive but enjoyed ourselves. Very quiet rooms. Took baths.

title: Michael G at front desk went above and beyond to make our stay memorable
text:
Super clean comfortable and fantastic ambiance 
The best hotel we have ever stayed
Highly recommended 
Comfortable beds fantastic rooms and decor takes you back to old New York 
Michael G made our stay extremely relaxed and comfortable  
Thank you Michael G

title: In short- go!
text:
We could not have enjoyed our stay more. From the moment we arrived, to celebrate a significant birthday over from the UK, we were made to feel welcome and every special.
The history of the hotel really adds to the allure, and the renovations have been completed sympathetically but clearly with a knowledge of what the modern guest will need.
The bar is a very cool place, no doubt too cool for me, but we were made to feel like we belonged and were well looked after.
Overall we couldn’t have asked for a better hotel - it was the hotel staff that really made this place sing.

title: Best time in NY
text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel and having a clean and cosy escape from the city. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, rooms beautifully decorated, quiet, and excellent service being able to get into a very sought after restaurant and bar. We will be back!

title: Such a beautiful place
text:
The fabled Hotel Chelsea, famous (or infamous) for so many reasons.
A historical hotel that fell into decay for many years, BUT after investment and regeneration, now resembles what it was intended for.
I took some photographs from outside and the incredibly friendly concierge invited me inside to take more photos!
I was able to take quite a few photographs of this beautiful interior with nobody querying which was really nice. Staff were all pleasant and guests seemed totally at ease in this historic building.
I took a menu as a souvenir.
Lovely place, fantastic interior.......but above all, friendly and helpful staff.

title: The Perfect NYC Hotel
text: This is such a special hotel. It retains all of the charm that you expect from New York's most iconic hotel, but with the updates and luxe feel that make it modern and deeply comfortable. It's great for a quick work trip or a leisurely long weekend. I travel to NYC a lot and have finally found my hotel.

title: A total gem
text:
Been travelling to nyc for 20 years staying at dozens of hotels.  This is the best.

From the chill community vibe at the door to the gorgeous renovation of a historic place.  To the history. And the updated spa and gym.  Also superb (but expensive) food (nyc prices- ug!).

Only quibble is the 23rd Street vive. But it's a fantastic location for going everywhere..

Been back twice and booked 3rd stay.

Love this place.

title: Unique and Superb Hotel!
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Chelsea. The recent renovation has successfully revived a classic, historic building with an amazing history. the rooms are unique and comfortable. the staff superbly friendly and helpful and the location is terrific. Hghly recommend!

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel!  The combination of terrific value, tasteful and thoughtful renovation, great location, nice staff and interesting buzz make it my favorite hotel in NYC.  It is also worth noting that the south side of the hotel is very quiet - this is largely due to the very solid construction techniques used when it was built in 1884.  The fact that the.south facing rooms are not on 23rd street also helps.  This is my second visit in 4 months and I look forward to going back in March for business.

title: The Hotel Chelsea a home away from home
text: The hotel is charming, it is located in the center of Chelsea. The front desk staff is very helpful. The room was impeccable. The art work throughout the hotel was fun to look at. I did not feel like I was in a hotel but rather a home away from home. I would definitely repeat.

title: A magical stay
text: From the moment I walked in the door, I felt like the most special guest at The Hotel Chelsea. They have a way of making you feel like you’re both at comfortably at home but also like royalty. The staff was incredible from check in, to housekeeping, to the spa, to the lobby bar. Seamlessly excellent, efficient, attentive and kind. The room was absolutely dreamy, we had a beautiful balcony and a soaking tub. The room and the entire building are just gorgeous. You can see the attention to detail and craft that went into this restoration. And it’s been maintained in such a way that you feel like you’ve gone back in time but are in the most beautiful present moment.  This was everything I wanted for my 40th birthday and more. I will definitely be back, I honestly didn’t want to leave. Definitely treat yourself to this experience, visit the lobby bar for an iconic cocktail(s), get a facial at the spa, and bask in the beauty of this fantastic place, surrounded by the best people.

title: Impressive hotel!
text:
A beautiful, clean hotel with beautiful rooms that are also quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. 
I appreciate the historical aspect of the property!  Plenty of good places to eat within walking distance. Would definitely stay there again on my next visit to NYC!

title: Glad we made the choice
text:
They did a great job making the hotel feel quaint and classic even though everything was new and updated.

Staff was very friendly. Room was very well appointed. Overall everything about the hotel was excellent.

We forgot a whole bunch of random things in the forest was able to give us all we needed. 

It was also nice to see the artwork from some of the residents along the stairwells and corridors. It was such a unique experience.

title: Great Stay, Highly Recommend
text:
LOVED the Hotel Chelsea. The staff are amazing, from the doormen through to room service. Rooms are great, bed super comfortable, nice bedding and cleaned to a very high standard. The bathroom are amazing, huge and great shower. I paid extra for a tub and it was definitely worth it. Breakfast at Cafe Chelsea was good, tried a number of dishes, and would highly recommend the burger also! We never made it to the Lobby bar but heard great things, and will definitely try the Spanish restaurant next time.
Will definitely stay here again next time in NYC, love the history of the place, and the renovation is sympathetic and done well.

title: Writing the review as I’m staying here…
text: I am a former hotel consultant and New Yorker who travels a lot and is very selective about the hotels I stay at. There’s got to be something beyond standard five star fare to pique my interest. Therefore the bar was high when I decided to do a staycation here in my hometown no less. And all I have to say is wow. They did a great job of honoring the soul of the old Chelsea Hotel while bringing it back to life in a more vibrant way, reviving a stretch of 23rd street and a neighborhood I’ve taken for granted. The standard Chelsea room where I am staying is small but well considered: a generous and comfy king bed, beautiful  bathroom and period furnishings that give you a sense of the hotel’s rock star pied a terre days. Hotel prices have become exorbitant and for the rate they charge they really didn’t skim on any of the details, from turn down service to the little Marvis toothpaste in the bathroom amenity kit.  The dining is not terribly imaginative but assuredly delivers the classics, and perhaps more importantly brings back a buzz and people watching element that is so rare in the city these days.  Overall a great homage and addition to this our beloved town.

title: Amazing hotel, they really knocked it out of the park!
text: This was my second time staying at the hotel, I had been waiting for it to open since renovations started back in 2010. I cannot recommend this place more. Came in and stayed with my friend. I had booked the Premier and was upgraded to the pied de terre. Let me just say it was amazing. Between the history of this hotel and the design it's my new favorite spot. The only thing that was disappointing was that the bar was closed for a private event. I had been planning to go to it for the evening but I am coming back in April for a few days so I will get to hang there then. I didn't think I could love any hotel more than the Bowery Hotel but  I do. The Chelsea is the best!

title: Everything and more, just stunning!
text:
Absolutely amazing hotel, everything and more!
From walking through the front doors of ‘The Chelsea’ to checking out, everything was perfect!
Such a stunning hotel with staff to match.
The lobby is warm and welcoming, stylish and charming.
The ‘Superb Balcony’ room was stunning and sumptuous.
Wonderful huge comfy bed and linens.
Furnishing were luxurious and carefully thought out.
Room was spacious with a super king bed.
The room overlooked West 23rd St and had two French doors opening onto the balcony.
The original fireplace was a beautiful focal point.
Bathroom was roomy with exquisite fittings, massive towels and fluffy bathrobes.
Marshall amp and Nespresso machines in the rooms are cool extras.
The artwork throughout the hotel is fabulous as is the magnificently restored staircase and lobby bar.
Staff were friendly, helpful and very welcoming.
Turn down service with handmade chocolates was a treat.
This hotel oozes charm, has all mod cons but respects its past.
Simply the best hotel I’ve ever stayed it, just wonderful!

title: A Stay at The Hotel Chelsea (with a side of honey and lemon)
text:
I stayed at The Hotel Chelsea the last weekend in October 2023. Like most reviewers have mentioned, I too was excited to step into history...and while my trip didn't go as planned...the hotel and the staff exceeded my expectations and made it a trip I would never forget.  

I had been in NYC for a week doing some work before checking into the Chelsea for a three-day stay. At some point during the week, I must have touched the wrong subway pole because within two hours of my stay...I was down for the count. Lucky for me, the staff upgraded my room when I checked in, which worked out considering I didn't leave it for three days. The hotel staff got word that I was sick after a hilarious room service call I had with a gal named Mercedes. Soon after, there was a knock at my door...and when I answered I saw a tray of hot water with lemon and honey waiting for me. This continued throughout my stay.  I'll say one thing...if you're gonna be sick in New York City, be sick at The Hotel Chelsea.

When I wasn't taking Benadryl-induced naps or soaking in my giant tub, I would walk out onto the balcony and watch the city work. Steps away from that iconic sign, I realized that no amount of sickness could ruin this moment. That being said, I'm looking forward to my next visit to the Chelsea, which I've already booked for early March 2024. I'm excited to see if the sensation I felt while walking to my room was, in fact, the presence of legends and ghosts...or if it was just my fever kicking in. See You Soon!

title: Fantastic Birthday Stay!
text:
My husband and I had the most fabulous birthday stay at The Hotel
Chelsea! While everyone we met - doormen, bellmen, front desk, waiters, housekeepers and bartenders - were extremely helpful and friendly, Cedric at the front desk went above and beyond to ensure my husbands birthday was absolutely fabulous. Thank you, Cedric!! Aside from one of the most wonderful hotel staffs we have ever encountered - and we travel extensively - the hotel itself is chic and gorgeous. The high level of design and finishes runs throughout all the public spaces and certainly to our uncommonly large and beautiful one bedroom suite.  The amenities in the room, which included a large and varied selection of drinks, snacks and sundries, as well as the bathroom and vanity products were top notch.  We so appreciated the birthday card and lovely bottle of wine. I can’t recommend this hotel enough and can’t wait to return!

title: Highly recommended: comfortable, quiet, friendly, and excellent service.
text:
Sweet, clean, and well-appointed, room, lovely, friendly staff who seemed as jazzed to work there and take care of we guests as we were to stay there.

The only downside was the darkened closet. This is the second high-end hotel I’ve stayed at in the past few months, and the second room that was graced with so little light that you had to guess the color of the clothing you had hung on the almost invisible hangers. 

I think there’s some influencer who posted on the PoshHotel website that insists that guests are more appreciative of sepulchral ambience than they are of actually being able to visualize what’s in bureau drawers, on the pole, or at the bottom of the cabinet. 

On the other hand, the coffee was delicious, the bathroom palatial, the bed comfortable, and the window large and operable (to a practical point). The room was also quiet and the dark was not a drawback while trying to sleep. 

The location was fantastic, easily within a short walk from most places we had a mind to visit. The history of the place is astonishing, the café serves tasty food, and if we had more time, we’d be stoked to try the Spanish tapas restaurant and the bar that were on site. 

A total treat!

title: A gorgeous walk back in time with perfect service
text:
The hotel was recommended by a local NYC friend. The location is brilliant for Manhattan, East and West Villages and the high line. The building is historic, impeccably restored with brilliant service.
It’s a walk back in time, without any of the old or dilapidated aspects one would find in older hotels. 
The bar is gorgeous and the cocktails to die for. 
Fully recommended!

title: High praise for the Hotel Chelsea
text:
Chosen place to stay when visiting NYC xx
The staff are wonderful, the location is central and the building itself (aside from being historic) is beautifully outfitted. Also love the lobby bar for a work session or lovely late night drink. Highly and warmly recommend ❤️

title: Superb in every way
text: Superb in every way.   No need to say anymore, but the rooms are beautiful and authentic, the staff is great, and it is an experience in itself.  It is great that they were able to maintain the original ambience of the hotel, while providing all the amenities of a high end establishment.

title: Not cheap, but actually worth it
text:
Celebrated New Year’s Eve in the city and stayed at the Chelsea. The suite with the balcony is like having an apartment and it’s awesome.
It has real character and charm besides being high-end and well furnished. You can’t get the same feeling in a place made of concrete and glass.
The soaking tub was great the bed really comfortable, the staff definitely aiming to please

title: Old classic back to town
text:
An old classic back to life almost intact. I ve been here several times
In the 90,s and it was wonderful to be back and also have a permanent resident near our room.
Rooms large and comfortable staff kind and helpful. The lobby bar which I did not remember is a nice spot.

title: Most helpful, polite, ready to assist customer needs that I found so far in New York. They make you feel like a king.
text: I was impressed by how polite and helpful the staff is. The greet you all the time, the hold the door for you, they come to your room and ask how you are doing, etc. Make you feel like a king. Often in New York people providing service can be rude. Not the Chelsea Hotel staff! Staff are trained to make the customer feel appreciated. Good job Chelsea Hotel!

title: Fabulous
text:
We visit New York City 2-3 times a year and have stayed in many hotels. Most have been ok but we’ve been wanting to find a “favorite”. We finally did. The Chelsea hit all the sweet spots. Fantastic staff. Michael at the front door couldn’t be more personable, helpful and attentive. The front desk staff were friendly and pay attention to detail. I asked for something to be delivered to our room that couldn’t be accommodated before we needed to leave for dinner. I stopped at the desk to cancel the request until later. Upon our return they asked if we still needed the delivery. Remembering the little things is so important. 
The room was small but well laid out, the mini bar is stocked with fun high end items and it was clean and comfortable. 
The lobby bar is fabulous. Natasha and Corey were friendly, efficient and fun to talk to. We stopped in every night we stayed. 
See you in March. Cheers.

p.s. 
I was back in the city last month. Couldn’t stay here because I was with a friend and there are no double rooms. 😞  We did, however, come for dinner. Anika took very good care of us. Stopped and said hello to Michael who was just as charming as ever.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
Beautiful hotel which was in a really good position to visit the sights in New York.
Hotel was clean and tidy.
Staff really helpful and knowledgeable.
I would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay in it again.

title: An unforgettable Christmas stay
text:
When I was 18 I watched the somewhat highbrow BBC Arena arts documentary about life at The Hotel Chelsea, it had fascinated me and I'd always wanted to visit. With the refurb finished, and despite some reservations about gentrification, I decided that we should go and stay over Christmas. It was expensive and towards the top of the budget so my expectations were high. But delighted to say I loved my time there and felt really at home. They were kind enough to offer us an upgrade to the Pied a Terre apartments, which really helped us have a great and relaxing stay.

I really have no criticism of the apartments the beds were super comfortable and the apartment spacious and homely, but sone with style and taste. There where a few minor wrinkles that I only mention as to offer scope for making things even better: 1) There are some paint splatters on the grey/white marble tiles, it just needs someone with a good eye to scrap them of. 2) Some of the bathroom fittings are a little poorly done (loose or away from the wall), and again a component maintenance man could fix these. 3) Brass is a nightmare as it needs polishing, in general I didn't might the patina but around the toilets and in the bathrooms it looked a little unclean. 4) The sealant around the bath in 3E is beyond amateurish, it just needs redoing. 5) The hallways could benefit from some coat storage to prevent clutter in the apartment, especially if the weather is poor you've nowhere to put wet things. 6) The lighting in the closets is a great idea, but the top shelf stops the light illuminating the clothes making it a little useless. None of this impinged on our stay and the uniqueness and history more than made up for those tiny details.

Not sure how I can justify and return visit but I'm working on it. Loved it.Thanks to all the staff in the hotel and Cafe Chelsea for the warmth and hard work.

title: While the word is hackneyed it’s “cool”
text:
Only an overnight stay en-route ex the QM2 to Maine.

What a fabulous place.  Superb staff, extremely comfortable and the room (upgraded) was an absolute belter. 

The bar quite literally blew my socks off - it was rammed and had a really great NY “feel” 

I absolutely loved it (darling)

title: One year anniversary holiday trip
text: We picked The Hotel Chelsea for our one year anniversary trip to NYC. The hotel did not disappoint and was very accommodating of our needs. Picture perfect stay for the holiday season. The neighborhood had great shops for shopping. The location was great for getting to the Broadway show in Times Square. We will definitely be back.

title: My favorite hotel
text: I stayed at the Hotel Chelsea twice this year and I’m staying again in 2024. It’s my favorite hotel. It’s spectacularly clean and comfortable, filled with history, the staff is so kind and helpful. Absolutely worth it.

title: Worth the renovation cost -~it’s outstanding.
text: The most exceptional hotel from top to bottom. The staff are warm, friendly yet very professional. Adhered to my every need whatever I asked for they would get it.  The rooms are gorgeous. What else can I say ~maybe bring a piano in bring the music back I’ll play for free. Love love love.

title: WONDERFUL!
text: The only place we ever want to stay in NYC. The attention to detail in design is outstanding. Thoughtful touches around every corner. The restaurants and bars are elegant, delicious, and friendly. A really special place and worth the money. The location is perfect to get to anywhere in the city and the unique history of the hotel adds a level of mystique and glamour.  A very special mention to Michael and Marissa at the front desk who were so kind and generous during our stay! This hotel should be on everyone's list to try and, as a travel agent, it will be an easy sell to my groups and individual clients. Highly recommend!

title: Amazing Stay
text: What a wonderful stay at the Hotel Chelsea. From check-in to check-out our stay was tremendous. The hotel just oozes with character and history. The staff were all wonderful and our room felt like our own mini apartment. All of the amenities were top notch, the bed was comfortable and the mini bar and snacks in the room were the best we've ever seen. This is now our go to hotel for future trips into the city.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text:
We stayed for 3 nights in a Junior Balcony Suite. and loved this place. 
Very large well appointed room with a super comfortable bed and lounge area.
Bar and restaurant both vibrant with good service.
Great location on 23rd street, with subway 100yards away and a ten minute walk to Greenwich Village.
Now our 'go to' hotel in New York

title: My favorite New York hotel!
text: The hotel is historic and legendary, old with beautiful architecture.  The renovations to the guest rooms and the interior spaces has restored its elegance, and my room and bed were very comfortable and well appointed. I will stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

title: What an Experience!
text: Thank you for your hospitality, we truly enjoyed our experience!  The hotel is absolutely beautiful.  The food and drinks were so delicious but it was your team that truly made it special.  We were constantly greeted with a smile and care.  We look forward to returning next time we're in the city and I'll ensure to recommend Hotel Chelsea to others.  Keep up the great work!

title: Great  stay in every way.
text:
The hotel has captured the essence of old world luxury while tastefully updating the amenities - everything works and yet the feeling is of a luxury hotel from years ago. The staff is extremely helpful and responsive. 
I am glad we had a chance to experience this restored architectural masterpiece.

title: The Chelsea Hotel- The Place To Stay and Enjoy
text:
The Hotel Chelsea is an upscale hotel with terrific staff, pristine, full of luxury amenities, with a great locale and an excellent Cafe Chelsea full service restaurant and the Garden food service.
Thank you for the top notch Chelsea room.
Sincerely,
Antoinette Lucente 
A repeat customer

title: Beautiful and charming hotel!
text: When I walked into the hotel, I felt like I went back in time. The lobby and rooms are beyond charming. Yet, the hotel felt very modern at the same time. From the Nespresso machine to the rain shower, I felt pampered from the moment I stepped into The Chelsea. Super convenient to the Subway. I was into and out of the city quickly and easily. My room was so quiet and super comfortable. I was in New York for business, and I never sleep well on business trips. Except this time. I am already looking forward to another stay at The Chelsea. Wonderful staff. Beautiful hotel. I loved every minute and wished I could have stayed longer.

title: Beautiful, inviting and cozy - highly recommended!
text:
Our stay at The Hotel Chelsea was superb. The staff was friendly, helpful and always went above and beyond. The ambience is beautiful and inviting; we ate breakfast in the gorgeous lobby most days and loved it. Our room was impeccably clean, expertly furnished and decorated, and very quiet even though we were directly on the streetside of the building with large windows.

When we return to New York for our next visit, we will absolutely be staying at the Chelsea again; the location, charm and comfort was unmatched. Highly recommend for those that don't want to be directly in the mad bustle of Times Square, but still want to be a highly walkable area with quick access to multiple train lines.

title: One of the most charming hotels I’ve ever been to in my very long history of traveling
text:
I cannot even begin to explain how amazing my stay was at Hotel Chelsea. There’s so much history and charm in every corner of the hotel. The staff are very friendly and you feel like you’re coming back home which is something very unlikely at most hotels. My room was very cozy and the attention to detail in the design and the service is impeccable. I also forgot to mention how nice and well equipped the gym is and it was a big plus for anyone who likes to get in a work out while traveling. This is definitely my favourite hotel in New York and I am never staying anywhere besides Hotel Chelsea whenever I visit.

I would like to thank everyone from the front desk to the house keeping, restaurant staff, and room service for making my stay unforgettable.

title: GREAT people, but way too dark and loud for us.
text:
To start, I HATE writing anything but stellar reviews, so please understand this is tough, but I want to be honest. 

The people who work the hotel are amazing. Happy, upbeat, great service and willing to go that extra mile. Michael, one of the porters is exceptional as was Tom from the (future to open) spa. THEY, I suspect -along with all of the other great people-are what make the reviews of this hotel so great. 

But for me and my wife it ends there,

The hotel is old. It has some charm and appeal, but know that it's loud, sound carries and the walls are not thick. You'll hear a lot from outside your room and for me, that really affected my sleep and experience, 

The rooms are small, and while that's expected in NY, for what I paid, I can get much bigger in other parts of the city where I feel there is much more to do. It was me and my wife and there just wasn't enough room to put our clothes away. And nobody told us that the balcony we had on the room was a shared balcony with several rooms, so people could walk right by the room if they wanted.

The bathroom is big compared to the room, but REALLY wonky. Took forever to get the temp of the water right and even then, if we used the overhead shower, water ended up all over the floor. VERY odd. 

The bar was nice, but the drink was awful and the server seemed like they couldn't care less about us. Not a smile, not any pleasantness. Maybe they were having an off day, but it definitely detracted from the experience. 

But the real reason for writing this review isn't the paper thin walls or the wonky bathroom or even the small room. It was how dark everything was. Like REALLY dark. We turned all the lights up to their fullest and we still couldn't even see into our drawers in the closet. It was very dim and very depressing. So much so that we actually checked out and found another hotel. I've never done this before. The darkness was so depressing. I realized that I like light and airy and fun. Sadly, this hotel was none of those. 

So, I am sure that for many out there reading this, the nostalgia of the old building or the great people or the antique pictures will be the allure. It simply wasn't;t for me and my wife and while I had a hard time writing this, I wanted to be honest for all those out there who may be like minded.

title: Classic NYC hotel experience you don’t get many places anymore.
text: What a great hotel. Classic, real hotel experience that unfortunately you don’t get many places. Will definitely stay at the Hotel Chelsea again on our next visit to nyc. The hotel is classic in every way, the details in the room from the furniture to the light switch’s make your feel like you are staying in a real classy place.

title: Our stay at The Hotel Chelsea was the best part of our trip.
text: This was my husbands first trip to NYC, we covered a lot of ground. We visited the 911 Memorial, OWTC, The Late Show, museums, broadway show, Highline and lots more and staying at The Hotel Chelsea was the BEST part of our trip! The staff and all the amenities were awesome. Every day we made time to come back and relax in our room, that was not on our agenda :) We can't wait to come back!

title: Beautiful stay and exemplary staff
text: Our daughter was married at your hotel this past weekend and the entire stay was a magical and perfect experience. The hotel is so beautiful. The rooms were spotless. Every single employee we encountered during our stay was friendly, kind and accommodating. I was struck by how happy they all seemed to be doing their jobs. I’ve traveled all over the world and this collective staff of employees is the best I have ever encountered. Highly recommend and we will be back in the future. Thanks to all for making this such a wonderful experience!

title: Amazing - 5 stars
text: We went for a wedding on 11-11 in the hotel. Everything was amazing. When we booked it , I reached out to hotel and they accommodated us like we were vip guests. The hotel is iconic and you feel a part of history. The room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities. We all had a good night sleep !  The staff was incredible . From front desk to the people working the wedding. They smiled and laughed and joked around and it was like being at a friends for a party !  We were given a comp breakfast bc we thought they had a continental and we were wrong but they did made sure we ate anyway ! I can’t wait to go back and stay again !

title: A fabulous few days at the Chelsea Hotel
text: Everything was about as perfect as it gets.  Everyone on staff was very friendly and efficient.  Our room was gorgeous and so comfortable.  Turn down service in the evening included bottled water and chocolates.  The hotel is beautiful and full of art and history.  I felt special and privileged to be staying in this historic place.  The only negatives were a long wait to be seated in the Cafe Chelsea even though we had a reservation.  But the staff made sure we had champagne and appetizers while we waited.  The air conditioning was not working properly but staff addressed it immediately and we were given a free breakfast.  The neighborhood had some construction going on but other than that, it was pleasant enough and close to some good restaurants and shopping.  Another plus - we could see the Empire State Building from our room.

title: Surpassed my great expectations!!
text:
We truly loved our stay at the absolutely sensational Hotel Chelsea. Warm, welcoming,  professional staff, gorgeous rooms and a fabulous location.  Bed was super comfy and the room was quiet. Thoughtful amenities including coffee in the room and if you forget something, the hotel has you covered with anything you might need.  Cool, vintage vibe with lots to take in around every corner. 

So much to do nearby including the Gotham Comedy Club next door, amazing restaurants (Buddakan!) Chelsea Market, The Highline, and the list goes on…for my gym friends, Peloton studios is a 15-20 minute walk, Row House is across the street and Orange Theory is just 300 m away if that’s your jam.

title: Always a memorable stay
text:
We have been staying at the Hotel Chelsea since it opened. Every stay has been great. The front desk staff are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are designed with great care: modern but with respect for the history of the building. The beds are super comfortable and the bathrooms luxurious. 

This trip we ate at the newly opened Cafe Chelsea. The food and service were exemplary. It is the perfect place for a leisurely breakfast. Also, we always enjoy dinner at El Quijote. Both restaurants are accessible from inside the hotel and perfect for nights when you don’t want to venture too far away. 

We are looking forward to our next stay before the year ends.

title: On repeat
text:
My third? fourth? Solo stay? Feels like a secret (but popular) getaway…
So unique, and beautifully restored! The beds are deeply comfortable, the staff is upbeat and ready to assist - both the Cafe & the Lobby Bar are destinations unto themselves .. both spaces are sexy with good lighting and interesting patrons.

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: Simply stated, one of the coolest hotels anywhere. From the oversized suite 1,100sq ft, to the amazing balcony, lobby, bar etc.  Our room (#3-U) had a full fancy kitchen, a giant bathtub a separate shower, and an awesome design overall. Love the artwork throughout the hotel. We even had a washer and dryer.  It definitely put a dent in the wallet but worth every penny.   Major thanks to Michael at the door and Courtney in the lounge, both consummate hospitality pros.  Sadly, no ghost sitings.

title: Best Historic Hotel in NYC
text: As a history lover, staying at the Chelsea Hotel was a once in a lifetime experience that I hope to repeat one day. I loved it! Everything was perfect! I'm addition to the great ambiance, the bed was very comfortable. I loved having one of the iconic balcony rooms all to ourselves.

title: The Hotel Chelsea is the coolest new hotel in NYC
text: This was my first time staying at the hotel, and I must say that I was thoroughly impressed with every aspect of my experience. Every staff member I encountered was incredibly friendly and helpful. The attention to detail in my room was impeccable, and the hotel itself perfectly embodied the historic charm of New York City. I was thoroughly impressed and can't wait to return!

title: The Hotel Chelsea is a stunning experience
text: The re-opening of this legendary place has been done with care.  It's a beautiful building.  Nice refreshed spaces lovingly (and slowly!) done.  Some of the long -time residents are still there (though if not gratis, probably could not afford to eat or drink at the pricy restaurants).  Towering over all else - the service - effortless, kind, genuine.  The other guests are hence really down to earth (they talk to you!) and a diverse (though well heeled, to afford these prices) blend.  And while the comfy, clean and cool rooms are dark (small windows, poor lighting) and a bit small for the price - overall, the experience puts it up there as one of NY's best hotels.  I'll be back!

title: Amazing Experience
text: The Hotel Chelsea always feel like stepping back in time with rock n roll royalty. Once one walks in the front door and is surrounded by artwork that was traded by many of the past residents for rent they know this will be a different hotel experience. The charming front desk staff are knowledgeable and efficient. The rooms are decorated in a manor that are elegant in an old world/rock way. I love the “burn” holes in the curtains, the brass finishes and the abundance of marble in the bathrooms.  I highly recommend this for lovers of art, music and unique interior design.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The experience was truly magical.  We had read some of the articles and books about the hotel and its renovation and the hotel and staff delivered.  The decor in the suite we had was par excellence, and although our stay was only one night, it will be remembered always.  This will work for future business stays for me as well because of proximity to subway.

title: High quality, unique experience, full of character and history
text:
High quality, unique experience. The renovation is a masterpiece and still holds and honors the essence of the Chelsea while elevating it even further. Everything was perfect and with so much rich history and character. Lively and fun atmosphere in all of the hotel cafes and bars, never sleepy in the city that never sleeps. The staff was attentive and warm. Walking in felt like coming home and it's partly because the Chelsea is still home to actual tenants who have lived in the building for over 40 years. 
There is original artwork by former tenants everywhere. There are original castings and architectural details from the 1800s. 
A highlight of the trip was having a private tour of the hotel from William, hopefully that will continue as it really enriched our experience of the hotel and solidified our decision to come back for another stay as soon as January. 
The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The balcony doors and windows surprisingly blocked out the street noise, and we had a room on the 23rd Street side, but we didn't hear any street noise. The lighting is perfect and all have dimmers. The walls are thick and we didn't hear any neighbors from any angle. It was quiet, peaceful, comfortable, romantic and wonderful. 
The only negative would be that our fridge had a divider that only allowed it to hold drinks and not any take out boxes, but all of the rooms in the hotel are different, so other rooms probably have a different fridge. 
Otherwise a perfect stay and cannot wait to come back again and again!

title: The Hotel Chelsea - One of a kind, and now ultra luxe
text: A legendary property now updated to perfection; history, style, comfort and service in equal measure. Easily my favorite place to stay in New York now. The design update is flawless. The bar is one of the best in New York. Rooms are spacious and appealing. Restaurants are fabulous.

title: Ecstatic to check in, reluctant to leave!
text: A dream come true to stay at the Chelsea. From the moment you walk through the door, you're treated like the stars who lived here and created so much art here. The staff are fantastic, the atmosphere is such a vibe and the rooms are fantastic. The Chelsea is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and the only disappointment I felt during my stay was when I was packing my case to leave. A must-visit hotel in New York city. 10/10. Thank you to the team for such a welcoming, brilliant stay.

title: Ett andra hem
text: Att bo på Chelsea Hotel är som att komma hem. Rummet var väldigt vackert inrett och sängen var otroligt skönt. Det fanns allt som en gäst kan behöva. Minibaren var mer att se som en maxibar. Och badrummet var utrustat med allt som även den mest kräsna kan behöva.

title: The best hotel in New York
text: We had our wedding here and stayed for a few extra days. I can't say enough good things about the service of this hotel, the quality of the food or drinks and how nice everyone you meet there are. The renovation has been done meticulously well.

title: A PERFECT STAY
text: Our stay at the Hotel Chelsea was absolute perfection. From our beautiful and immaculate  room to the friendly and helpful staff to our wonderful meals and drinks at Cafe Chelsea and the Lobby Bar to wandering the halls and admiring the art — we loved it all. We definitely felt we were part of something special and historical and magic.

title: Fantastic stay
text:
The story of the Hotel Chelsea is what drew us there. It didn’t disappoint. So much history!
The staff were exemplary and the comfort and attention to detail in the room was excellent, including the umbrella in the room to use during your stay. 
We’d love to return some day.

title: Best NYC hotel
text: Best NYC hotel experience we’ve ever had. The details from decor to the cafe are exceptional, and the beds are incredibly comfortable. Highly recommend getting a room with a tub, and also ordering the chocolate soufflé at the cafe, as well as everything else on the menu.

title: Great Experience
text: Everything was great.  The people working here are very nice and helpful, the lobby is large and comfortable, the decor throughout the hotel is very nice, the room was clean with a large closet and large bathroom, the soap/shampoo were very nice, the cocktails in the bars were creative and strong, the location was very convenient since most subway lines have stops on 23rd st.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Book a place in history
text: Favourite Hotel in NYC 🥰 My husband booked this place for us in August to stay. The rooms are stunning and immaculate throughout. The staff are welcoming and friendly. The whole place has got so much history and tales to tell, you felt you had a connection to the place. We didn’t eat here and only used the bar once. The room bar is overstocked from a chocolate bar to something for the weekend!!

title: Magic Chelsea Memories
text: The service at the hotel was exemplary and we were made to feel welcome and all our questions were answered patiently and politely. The bar was amazing and I have to mention the delicious cocktails, shout out to the mixologist! I loved the room, the decor was respectful to the hotel´s heritage but also cosy and fashionable at the same time, and the room had all the modern amenities you could wish for. The bathroom was divine and I could have stayed in the huge shower for hours. The bed was so comfortable, I should have checked what kind of mattress it was as I want one! We stayed in a balcony room and so got to pose under the sign which was another great memorable moment for me. I´ll be back one day and for longer next time!

title: We loved everything about Hotel Chelsea!
text: The hotel has struck the perfect combo of fresh while nodding to it’s storied history. The rooms are gorgeous (nespresso maker!!!) with beautiful bathrooms and the service was fantastic. Great location, too.

title: Less than memorable
text:
We were interested to stay here having read about the reopening of the hotel and its history. But our experience was rather disappointing. 
We had one of the larger rooms on 10th floor which was a nice size  and I quite liked the furnishings though my husband was less enamoured. The big problem though was the lack of light. When it was dark outside the level of lighting in the room was far too low. Even worse there were no proper reading lights beside the bed so reading in bed was impossible. How was this overlooked in the refurbishment?
Breakfast was ok but not brilliant. I thought the fruit was tainted on our first morning but my avocado toast was better another morning. 
Most of the staff were nice and friendly with a couple of exceptions. On our first morning the hostess continued talking to a colleague and left us standing at the door so in the end we seated ourselves. And finally when we left at 5am and the hotel was otherwise deserted, the two receptionists  left us to struggle with our luggage through the front door as we left rather than help us. 
Overall: a somewhat dreary experience.

title: Williams Tour
text:
The Hotel Chelsea  has been richly renovated  with elegance and warmth. We enjoyed a really fine dining experience and to top off a stay that exceeded our expectations Williams historical knowledge of The Chelsea created a spellbinding tour that Is not to be missed . 
Thank you for your time William and the unique touch you bring to this iconic NYC Hotel/Destination .

title: Unique New York Experience
text: A beautiful and stylish restoration of a historic hotel but with all expected comforts and with artworks (and reputedly a few ghosts) everywhere. Young and enthusiastic staff. Excellent service in bar and restaurants. Great location handy to subway and neighborhood restaurants.

title: Unbelievably amazing
text:
What a wonderful place to stay and the friendly, kinda staff were superb! The hotel has such amazing charm and history it truly felt like a museum we stayed at! We even got a tour guide from the hotel named William- and he gave us such a special tour to add to the excitement of that place! It was wonderful - the hotel room was sooo spacious and beyond cozy! Cleanliness was at its finest!!!!! The food was impeccable and delicious - every bite was remembered! Thank you to William and the entire staff for such a great stay at CHELSEA HOTEL! My mom, sister and I had a very memorable week! 

Love, 
Chelsea

title: The Magic is Still There
text: The magic of the Chelsea still exist. Now completely updated but not an ounce charm was lost. The old bones of the building stand strong but now highly polished as they deserve. The new staff compliments the original tenants that were allowed to stay. Great respect was given to the building and its people. I was truly treated as one of them making it a memorable experience. This is not a typical hotel stay. It is special and you deserve it!

title: Rock n roll hotel gem in the heart of the city
text: I stay here all the time exclusively. I love the staff, rooms, the pillows are the fluffiest. I appreciate the historical significance, art work. Great to have meetings at and crash at. Lobby bar is great and the cafe is one of the best in all of New York.

title: Bday fun in NYC!
text:
So this hotel was a perfect fit for our three nights of fun in NYC!
First of all the hotel itself was just beautiful, rich in history, beautiful rooms and every staff member really gave us that nice warm feeling of “it’s great to have you here”
Centrally located for all things NYC …. Uber was always 1 minute away! And the subway too is just right there!
The bar and also the breakfast at the bar had lots of “wow!”
Historic and beautiful! We really loved it and had a great time! Definitely would return!

title: Wonderful Iconic Hotel
text:
The Hotel Chelsea is in the heart of Chelsea and has been restored to an extremely high level.
It is such an iconic and historic building and is festooned with the artwork of the residents who used to pay their rent by giving the hotel pieces of art.
The bars are beautiful and the bar staff, and all the other staff are exceptionally attentive and professional.
The rooms are very well equipped and very comfortable.

It was an absolute pleasure staying here.

title: Love this Hotel
text: We loved our stay at the hotel. We had a balcony which was super and sitting in the lobby for people watching during Fashion Week was tremendous.  Joanna at the front desk was especially accommodating and we appreciated that. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: A Gem of a Property
text: Hard to top this experience I'd say! We traveled up for the US Open with some friends and collectively had an amazing time! We felt welcomed, extremely well cared for, property was beautiful and staff was so attentive to every detail!!! I've found my new go-to when we need to stay in the city. Short walk to Penn Station as well, which never hurts, but that was far down the laundry list of things that made the Hotel Chelsea impressive.

title: A magnificent place to stay and play
text:
After reading the stories and history of the Hotel Chelsea for years, we finally visited and stayed for 2 nights, and what a joy it was!
All the rooms are lovely, and they so thoughtfully upgraded us too,  which was absolutely gorgeous. So, so comfortable and with everything you could need. All the staff were wonderful, so  friendly, relaxed and incredibly helpful with information about where to go in New York. The Lobby Bar and El Quixote restaurant served fabulous food and cocktails in beautiful surroundings. Loved that all the old ( and still) residents art works were throughout the hotel, and so enjoyed going up and down the beautiful historic staircase and around the corridors listening for echoes from its glorious colourful past.
Still smiling a week after returning, wishing we were still there, and already plotting a return for a longer stay next year. Thanks for making a dream become a gleeful reality.

title: Wonderful historic hotel
text: I stayed in the most modest room at the hotel. It was small, as expected, but everything was very nice. Clean. Comfortable. Ornate bathroom. The literary and artistic history alone is worth the stay. Recommended hotel.

title: Fabulous!
text:
From the “Welcome to the Hotel Chelsea” to the “ Thank you so much for staying with us and come stay with us again soon”,  our journey at the Hotel
Chelsea was incredible. This hotel deserves the highest ratings  given to a property. Tracy who checked us in gave us a complementary upgrade to an even more fabulous room than we had booked. We opened the door to our very spacious, meticulously clean , totally fashionable,  and over the top luxurious room. From there, our stay continued to be 5 star. The lobby bar is a throwback to an era when  cocktails were king and they have fully revived the experience. A Glamorous, exclusive feeling yet still totally welcoming. Climbing into bed we snuggled in our Italian linen sheets and woke up refreshed and ready to
enjoy the grand marble bathroom . 4 nights of absolute bliss. I can’t recommend this hotel enough and look forward to our upcoming stay in November.

title: Exquisite!
text:
Um.  The Hotel Chelsea is EVERYTHING! It was our anniversary and we had an incredible experience!  We did not want to leave.
The staff is genuinely caring, super attentive to everyone that walks in the front door.  I can go on and on about the front desk staff, housekeeping, bell captains (persons) but am allowed so many character counts! 
Our room was a complete design inspiration, When we returned home, I spent some time searching on-line where to find the rooms window coverings! All the hues in the room are beautiful jewel tones.  
Room service seemed more affordable than other places we have stayed at in the past. 
We are still on a happiness high from our stay and do not want the feeling to end!

title: Chelsea Hotel... If only these walls could talk !
text:
An amazing stay at the iconic Chelsea Hotel, wow... what a privilege ! Fabulous staircase with great artworks in each floor. Beautiful, clean and spacious room. We had a balcony facing the 23rd street on the second floor and the windows/doors are so well isolated that you can't hear the buzz outside. Love the lobby bar for drinks/cocktails.
 Very friendly and helpful staff. Simply magnificent...

title: Favorite & Coolest Hotel In New York!
text:
We stayed at The Hotel Chelsea last week for the third time in the past year & it was once again splendid! The hotel is a magical place, updated to with a gorgeous historical opulence without losing any of its rock & roll charm. We love roaming the halls & imagining the incredible creative figures that resided in the Chelsea over the years. Walking up & down the stairs, viewing the art created by various residents, really brings the ghosts of Chelsea past to life.

On this visit, we received a fantastic upgrade to a balcony suite that was huge! It was on the 4th floor, the very place where Leonard Cohen & Janis Joplin once lived and where Andy Warhol shot the film "Chelsea Girls" with Nico. We also took some memorable photos on the balcony that recalled some of the famous shots of Patti Smith & Robert Mapplethorpe in the 1970's.

Everyone who greeted us & assisted us at the Chelsea was incredibly welcoming & friendly. We felt like we were hanging with a friend every time we spoke to someone from the hotel.

The Hotel Chelsea has quickly become my favorite hotel in New York and one of my favorite places to hang out. Everything from the rooms, the lobby and the bar are awesome. We cannot wait to visit again!

title: Five Star Service, Rock Star Cool
text: From the warm and welcoming check-in to the beautiful rooms and the overall ambience of the place, this is my new favorite hotel, hands down. The staff are amazing and they are what make staying at HOTEL CHELSEA  such a great experience. All 3 restaurants are excellent. The Lobby Bar is a great place to sit and meet friends, work or simply people-watch. This is quintessential New York City. The coolest hotel in the world.

title: Super 4 stelle
text:
Hotel rinnovato in stile
Bellissimo
Atmosfera magica, sembra di entrare in un film
Posizione perfetta 
Meraviglioso anche solo per bere qualcosa o cenare
Personale gentilissimo 
Mi avevano consigliato di andare dopo la recente riapertura 
Ero scettica perchè online ha ancora il rating da 2 stelle, invece è stata una bella sorpresa
Consigliatissimo

title: Hotel Chelsea
text: This was my first stay at The Hotel Chelsea but, it will not be my last. I loved everything about the hotel. Walking in, the lobby is very inviting. I cannot say enough about the staff. So kind, so helpful. The room was beautiful yet comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect Birthday Getaway
text: My husband and I loved our quick getaway to the Hotel Chelsea. Though we live nearby in NJ, we decided to head stay the night to celebrate my husband's 40th. The friendly staff, clean and thoughtfully decorated rooms, convenient location, and diverse onsite dining options didn't disappoint. In our 'Deluxe' room, we loved the seating area, city view, Marshall speaker, Nespresso machine, comfiest bed, and gorgeous bathroom. El Quijote for dinner, The Lobby Bar for drinks, and room service breakfast were fantastic as well. Love the blend of old school and modern touches throughout, and as a lover of history, art, and exploration—this hotel had it all. Thank you for making our stay surprisingly memorable in the best way, Hotel Chelsea!

title: Gorgeous piece of history.
text: Gorgeous piece of history. Great staff. Food a bit pricey and bathroom, while well appointed, has 19th century square footage. Be prepared to lay towels on the bed if you are two or more. That said, I love it.

title: Just like I imagined but so much better!
text: The hotel is beautifully preserved! We were very early and stopped to see if the front desk would hold our bags and without asking we’re told our room was ready! The room was beautifully decorated, comfortable, clean, and exquisite taste. The bed was very comfortable. Front desk staff very pleasant. I will definitely be back. I loved everything about my stay.

title: Historic Gem
text: The Hotel Chelsea is a historic gem among NYC hotels. I've stayed in many, and none are as charming. The rooms are spacious - especially for NYC - and well decorated. Appliances and amenities, sheets, pillows, etc. are all high end. you can tell the place is well managed because the staff are all incredibly friendly. Like, genuinely nice and helpful. Highly recommend. Worth the money.

title: Gorgeous Boutique Hotel
text: This is my second time staying at this adorable hotel right in the heart of Chelsea.  From the moment you arrive at the door, you are greeted with a friendly welcome and smile, and offered assistance with your luggage.  Check in is a breeze and instantly you feel like you've gone back in time to a charming boutique hotel somewhere in the middle of Paris.  But it's NYC!  Even better.  The rooms are perfect and well-appointed with upgraded towels, robes, slippers and bath products.  The bedding is divine and ensures a great night's sleep.  The courtyard facing rooms are super quiet and there was no issue sleeping in.  The first time (back in March, 2023) I was upgraded to the Pied=a=Terre and it was amazing!  I could have stayed for a month.  This time, we were in a Deluxe King and it was lovely as well.  The bathrooms are large with oversized showers (unexpected in NYC). The Lobby Bar is a must as it's great for drinks and for people watching.  We also had dinner in the Cafe and everything we had was wonderful.  I can't say enough about the service as everyone we encountered was genuinely caring and eager to ensure our stay was perfect.  And it was!  I will be back again and again.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: This hotel was wonderful! From the doormen to the concierge, to the amazing room. Everything was beautiful and everyone was extremely friendly and helpful! The view from the balcony of the room was spectacular! This is a fantastic place to stay!

title: Meraviglioso hotel
text: Hotel storico ristrutturato da poco, un tempo era un posto per artisti bohemien ed ora risulta gentrificato ma con intelligenza: il restauro ha rispettato l'anima e la storia del posto in ogni dettaglio. La location è fantastica per visitare Manhattan, stanza confortevole personale gentilissimo. Consigliato per palati raffinati dove il lusso non è necessariamente ultra moderno. Letto ottimo. Abbiamo sentito la mancanza di una piccola scrivania e del necessario per preparare il caffè ma ne è valsa la pena abbiamo vissuto in una atmosfera newyorchese straordinaria.

title: More Than A Hotel
text: We were excited to stay at the newly renovated and iconic Hotel Chelsea and I’m thrilled to report that my expectations were exceeded! The renovation is miraculous and the hotel looks beautiful. The staff is extremely helpful, courteous, friendly and professional. Our room was perfect, the bar and lobby rooms are gorgeous and bustling with activity. A throwback to hotel lobbies of the past. And yet the Chelsea is completely modern. I highly recommend this incredible hotel for your next trip to NY. It’s more than a hotel, it’s an experience.

title: Must be the best hotel in NYC
text: Absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. Stayed 4 nights while we eloped to NYC and the Hotel Chelsea provided the perfect base. The room was amazing with a huge, comfy bed. The staff were really friendly and helpful. And the hotel itself was incredibly unique and beautiful. 10/10 experience. Can’t wait to stay again next time we visit.

title: Our go-to Manhattan hotel.
text: This hotel checks all the boxes.  Great location on 23d st near 8th Ave so three blocks from Penn Station and a few hundred feet from the subway station.   If you are a walker, Times Square and the theater district are slightly over a mile.  The room was spacious for Manhattan.  The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the air conditioning quiet and efficient.  The staff was friendly, professional and informative.  This will be our go-to hotel from now on.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: A fabulous hotel. We stayed last weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were lucky to have a street view ina very spacious room with a very nice bathroom. Breakfast has great options and is served in the Lobby Bar. The bar was buzzing on the Saturday night with a great atmosphere. Staff are very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay again.

title: WANT TO FEEL LIKE HOME?   STAY AT THE HOTEL CHELSEA!!!!!!
text:
This was our first time staying at The Hotel Chelsea but our second time in beautiful amazing New York City.

We are planning on visiting again for New Year's Eve (my fiance doesn't know yet but he will see the visa statement.)

ALL of the staff were truly amazing!!!!  The day of our check out I asked one of the doorman if he wanted to trade passports....he said NO.  I tried and then I CRIED!

I felt like we were at home for our 10-day stay at this amazing hotel.

Because of all the artwork in the hotel, I decided to paint the view from our balcony and left it in our room.

There is an art supply store directly across the street from our room so I thought "Why not!".  I'm NOT an artist but I tried!!

Gorgeous bedding, perfect pillows, and the best part....a balcony!!!! which I found very difficult to find in New York.

The Hotel Chelsea went well over and beyond my expectations. 

The very best part of The Hotel Chelsea is how much the staff makes you feel at home.  Professional yet personable at the same time.

The Hotel Chelsea is a win-win; 10 out of 10!!!!

Thank you to the management and staff for an amazing stay! 

I honestly wouldn't change one thing.

Perfect........Just perfect!!!

Looking forward to our next stay!

Penelope Wheeler & Jonathan Ross

ROOM #:  5X

title: What a stunning hotel
text: What an amazing hotel. Everything about our stay was first class. Staying here had been a lifelong ambition for my wife, and it did not disappoint. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and our room with the balcony was amazing. Better than I'd even expected. Even with the recent renovation, walking down the halls, you still get a feel of the history of the place. Without a doubt, it is the best hotel we've visited. We will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful stay
text: They have done a fantastic renovation and the hotel is absolutely beautiful and full of character--no longer just the funky kind of character that's a nice way of saying grunge (it had been that way back in the day, with all the writers, artists and musicians from its history amidst the physical decline of the building).  Now it's the history but with a refined, old-New-York classy kind of character that takes you back in time, perhaps closer to how the place was in its physical prime.  The staff is great--very helpful, very nice, just perfect.  I don't really want to say how wonderful it is because we won't be able to get in if everybody knows, but this is now our new favorite hotel in NY.  We had a balcony room with a fireplace and french doors below stained glass -- gorgeous.  Comfortable bed, lovely little table and chairs, huge marble and brass bathroom.  We'll be back!!

title: Romantic, luxurious and a bohemian dream
text: I wanted to take a moment and congratulate the team at The Hotel Chelsea. I was so impressed by the renovations, my luxurious room, the attentive and professional staff, and the bohemian history of the hotel. The room was spacious and well appointed and my partner and I found our 4 night stay to be one of the best experiences we've had in a long time. NY is always magical but even more so when you find an incredible hotel to love.

title: A Must Stay in Chelsea
text: Hands down the best hotel experience in NYC - staff was friendly and accommodating, amazing location and the rooms/property itself is perfection! The quality of the finishes were unmatched - unlacquered brass hardware, La Cornue stove, huge cast iron tub, gorgeous light fixtures all on dimmers and a heavenly king bed. Slept so well and will definitely be back.

title: An experience to remember
text: On my recent trip to the US I stayed in 21 different hotels. Some I don’t even remember, but the Chelsea is unforgettable. It is more than just accommodation, it’s an experience. And while the location and accommodation are excellent, it is the people drawn to this hotel, residents, guests, staff,  bar and restaurant patrons, and the stories they have to tell  that make staying there such an enjoyable and memorable experience. This is my favourite place in New York.

title: Astounding Remake Of The Past
text: I truly cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. From the moment we stepped out of our cab we were greeted with incredible service. All the bus boys we met during our stay were so kind and helpful. We stayed for my birthday and originally booked the king suite, but were upgraded complimentary to the one bedroom pied a terre. The renovations to the room were stunning -- the stained glass, the thoughtful fabrics on the bed frame, the gorgeous window panels. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom, the shower pressure, all fabulous. We had no idea a real draw here would be the downstairs lobby bar. We really appreciated that guests have priority (a rarity for NYC hotels!!) and while the prices were high they matched the level of service and, again, the gorgeous design and layout of the space. We had a night to remember getting dressed up and having cocktails and fries. The only potential draw back is that it does have a faint smell of cigarette smoke, but we found it charming and a reminder of all the amazing history this hotel has to tell. I will be making this my new work hotel and absolutely cannot cannot wait to return. Thank you to everyone at Chelsea!!

title: Bucket List Stay
text: This was a bucket list stay at The Chelsea. I've always been fascinated with it and when I had the opportunity to stay, I was thrilled. The staff is friendly and efficient. The rooms were great, the bed was comfy, the bathrooms extremely nice, and the history of the hotel, the artwork, the famous staircase were all wonderful to see. The bar was very nice and El Quijote restaurant was a highlight of our stay. Definitely worth the price. I can't wait to get back to my favorite city.

title: Staying at Hotel Chelsea - Dream come true
text:
My stay at Hotel Chelsea was a dream come true. Absolutely
the best hotel experience I have had so far.  The hotel is very beautiful, the recent refurbishment has been incredibly well done. If like me you are hoping to experience elements of the iconic original hotel you will not be disappointed.  My room was extraordinary, great view of 23rd St I was lucky enough to have a balcony beneath the iconic sign! The room was very luxurious, extremely vast and comfortable bed and the most beautiful rugs & curtains. The furnishings are classic and elegant. Amenities included essential coffee machine and lovely bath/ shower products. Chelsea  Hotel staff are extremely warm and helpful. Anything I needed arrived quickly, any issues resolved graciously. Breakfast room was great, food excellent and service very good.  I had the best experience ever here.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in NYC. 23rd Street is an excellent location, 10 minutes to Greenwich Village & Union Sq. I look forward to returning to the Chelsea at the first opportunity.

title: Historic, comfortable, fun and cozy
text: This hotel is so very lovely. Feels very warm and cozy and like a second home. I was always curious about the hotel's storied history but it's just a beautiful place to stay in the here and now. The doormen and the desk staff are kind and helpful.

title: A great experience at a legendary hotel!
text:
Staying at the legendary Hotel  Chelsea was a wonderful experience. The rooms are decorated with a vintage aesthetic. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was gorgeous. The entire hotel retains the original character, including the artwork on the walls. Loved the vibe of Lobby Bar,  where I enjoyed some delicious cocktails. 

And, I must mention the staff…everyone was friendly and helpful. My stay at the Hotel Chelsea delightful and memorable. I would definitely stay at the Chelsea again.

title: The perfect stay in NYC
text: Amazing in every way! We enjoyed every minute of our stay in this legendary hotel. SO beautyfully restored, so much to look at and enjoy and the most wonderful staff - very freindly, very helpfull and very cool also :-) We loved that there is still some residents living there, giving the hotel a feeling of both hotel and a residence builing. Without question the best of many stays in NYC.

title: Great Place Rich in History
text:
The Hotel Chelsea is steeped in Literary and Musical history. The recent updates have made this already iconic location a comfortable and luxurious stay. The heavy curtains and sheers in the room not only create a total blackout of light but evoke the rock n roll attire of legendary guests that stayed or lived at the hotel. It is New York so the rooms are not all large but they are carefully considered with lovely wool rugs, crisp pressed sheets and thick towels. The bathroom products are top notch. The Staff is ready to help with requests. The hotel bar has a great list of drinks and wines. My one wish is that the bar would have a soundtrack that would delve into the music of the greats that created some of their best work in those walls. The absence of music seems a bit out of step with everything else. I am working on list to play in my earbuds for the next trip. 
Rebekah

title: We’ll be back!
text: The atmosphere is lovely and romantic, the beds are very comfortable, and the shower is amazing! We loved our stay at The Hotel Chelsea!! The staff was friendly and very helpful in making sure we had everything we needed.

title: Gorgeous and comfortable
text:
Though I live in NYC, I'm a writer and occasionally take a week or so to cloister up at a hotel around the city for some distraction-free writing. The Hotel Chelsea has been on my nerdy little "hotel bucket list" for some time now, and I finally had the opportunity to spend some time there in July 2023.

Everything was spectacular. The prices for my visit were totally agreeable, despite being one of the most storied hotels in the city. The staff were brilliant (I sincerely hope they're paid well for the terrific service they provide).

The room I stayed in did not have a coffee maker, but I was provided one by the front desk with a quick call. From the moment I hung up the phone to the moment the coffee maker arrived must have been a speed record; I can't imagine a full minute went by.

The hotel itself is gorgeous. If you stay here, I beg you take a moment to explore the building a little. Everywhere you look is a detail waiting for you to notice it.

The bed, linens, towels, robes, pillows, were all perfectly comfortable. 

Though I still have other hotels on that aforementioned nerdy bucket list in my head… I will probably just stick with the Chelsea for my personal writing retreats from here on out.

title: Hotel Chelsea is Royal
text: A rebirth of a rebellious hotel that still holds a clash of punk rock, art and poetry. Stunning original art, famous staircases and spectacular views in rooms. I stayed on 2nd floor was perfect, can’t hear traffic, was right under the Hotel Chelsea sign. Had a tour from William which was super cool. A must stop and stay, you won’t get a better friendly staff!  I can’t speak to before the renovation but this vintage aesthetic art deco punk elegance is my favorite spot in NYC!

title: Feeling pampered
text: Very comfortable room, with exceptional historical and reproduced details. The photos don’t do it justice. We found it by accident (didn’t know it had re-opened), and have already booked an additional stay for another trip to the city.

title: The Chelsea is the Coolest
text: I was drawn to the hotel for it's historic significance and it didn't disappoint.  The hotel is beautiful, having preserved the craftsmanship of yesteryear with renovations of old world class and artistic funk.  The hotel is spotless and the staff is wonderful.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
My curiosity about this culturally referenced iconic hotel led to booking a room and discovering more than history. From warm welcomes at the front door, desk and lobby bar, to an impressive staircase and walls decorated with true artwork (created by legendary residents), I felt as though I  was transported in time.  While hotels now trim amenities, charge “resort fees” and provide small nondescript rooms with generic fake wall hangings, the Chelsea defies these trends. 

My room was spacious, with exquisite appointments of a bygone era,  plush bedding, a seating area to entertain guests, and a marbled bathroom.  Even the flooring and the inside of my closet were elegant.  Add in 21st century updates; a large wall mounted flat screen TV, primo A/C, and dimmer lights, their prices are comparable to other Manhattan hotels.  And instead of tooting their own horn on their website, they merely include a link to their Wikipedia page.

When I couldn’t figure out how to work the espresso machine (a charming red Nespresso, not a Keurig knock-off), a member of the desk staff escorted me to my room and provided a detailed tutorial….and refused to accept a tip.  
I could go on and on, but will end this review stating that while this was my first stay at the Chelsea, it isn’t my last.

title: More than just a hotel, an experience!
text:
A very well restored piece of history, vey confortable and with a great friendly staff. The bed was confortable, the bathroom (with a bath tube included) huge snd the staff friendly and helpful. 
Good value for money.

title: Outstanding stay
text: Outstanding.  Beautiful renovation. They upgraded us to a lovely spacious room. It was quiet and dark at night (not easy to get in NYC) so we slept very well.  All the public areas are artsy and cool.  Be sure to check out the bar and breakfast cafe. Would definitely stay here again.

title: THE ONLY HOTEL FOR ME
text: There is no better hotel. The renovation is masterful! The beds are like clouds. The parquet floors and thick carpets calm you. The huge tub melts all stress, aches and pains away, All the amenities you would want are handled. And the Lobby Bar is where all the action is- the guests and servers make this place extra special not to mention the insanely gorgeous ambiance in each chamber. I love waving my tassel key when I stroll into the bar to get seated right away. And I am enchanted by the resident's art that dons the hallways and staircase- worth slowly touring to take in all the amazing vibes of this place.

title: Fantastic stay at this stunning and historical NYC hotel.
