text: @hotelchelsea love our weekend stay at your stunning and iconic hotel. Newly renovated, but if the walls could talk. Best hotel stay. Amazing location. #NewYorkCity #IconicHotels. The staff, decor, beds, art, food all AMAZING! The hotel made our NYC weekend for us.

title: The Hotel Chelsea is my new favorite place to stay in NYC
text: The Hotel Chelsea is such a lovely place to stay. The renovation retained the history and charm, and added modern amenities and comfort. The location is central to the city, with the train, a coffee shop and market within a block. The staff is excellent, the hotel bar and restaurants are delicious and hip, and the rooms are very comfortable and quiet. We  loved everything about our stay.

title: Excellent.
text: Gorgeous hotel, all top quality fixtures and furnishings - very impressive.  Location in Chelsea can't be beat. High Line is two blocks away on 10th Ave, you can walk up it to Hudson yards, or down it to the 14th St and the very fashionable meatpacking district.

title: The Best
text: My daughter and I had the best experience at the Chelsea! Skip the boring, room-in-a-box hotels for timeless charm, character, interesting staff, and top-notch accommodations. Centrally located and everything you would want. Our favorite hotel! We'll be back.

title: Outstanding hotel experience in the heart of Manhattan!!
text: Chelsea is indeed a Fantastic Hotel. Great rooms, pretty much bigger than manhattan standards, very kind staff and a great location. To highlight the cleanliness of the rooms and the predisposition of the staff at all times. Absolutely recommendable!

title: Do Yourself a Favor and Stay at The Hotel Chelsea
text: You will not regret staying in this truly remarkable historical place that has been carefully renovated to let its history and beauty show through and a wonderful staff to boot! Don't miss the Lobby Bar and the El Quijote restaurant to complete the experience!

title: Wonderful stay, ideal location
text: The finishings are wonderful and lush, the bed is comfy, the staff is friendly and helpful. We loved our stay and all of the amenities. The building is full of history and has been updated while keeping true to the character and history of the site.

title: The Hotel Chelsea — a creative energy vortex
text:
I'm a New Yorker. As a frequent visitor of the hotel and its restaurants, I decided to stay for a couple nights to experience the full magic. It was all I imagined, and then some.

The Chelsea is one of the oldest, long-standing masterpieces of NYC. If you plan to stay here, respectfully understand that you are staying in a creative energy vortex, rich with layers of remarkable history. Bring your best self.

The hotel is undoubtedly beautiful, with several staples of the original space maintained including the iconic iron-marble staircase, fireplace, balconies, and many original art pieces adorning the walls. I stayed in the Superb Balcony Room which was extremely spacious, clean, and tastefully furnished. The lovely elements of French décor pay homage to the French-American origins of the Chelsea. A lot of care has been put into the charming details and thoughtful amenities from the moment you walk through the front doors to the moment you rest your head on your pillow. 

At the end of the day it's the people who make the place, and the staff/management is absolutely incredible. Everyone is warm and welcoming, eager to make your stay a memorable one. Make sure to check out the gorgeous Lobby Bar and century-old El Quijote restaurant for a delicious meal or drink. 

The avant-garde, eclectic, rock n' roll spirit is still alive, and the Chelsea has soul — no question. That said, it's up to us as her humble guests, to contribute to it.

title: Fantastic in every way
text:
Stayed in the Hotel Chelsea from 28th May to 1st June. From the moment I arrived at the front door I knew I would enjoy my stay. The atmosphere in the hotel is welcoming, unpretentious and fun. 
My room was spacious (Chelsea King) with large comfortable bed and good size bathroom. Nice view south also. 
Loved the bar, with great service and excellent cocktails. I only had one breakfast in the hotel (Avocado Eggs) which was gorgeous. The hotel staff were also extremely accomodating when I realised I had left my wallet on site after leaving. They couldn't have been more helpful.  Dave Quinn / Dublin

title: Breathtaking historic hotel
text:
I have been waiting for years to visit the Hotel Chelsea. We stayed for two nights, in an accessible king room . The room exceeded all our expectations. We loved all the small architectural touches - the inlaid floor with the hotel name, the wall cutouts, the closets and the fireplace. The decor also gave it a bit of a rock and roll vibe. The variety of artwork on the stairs was impressive and the lobby bar was perfect (we went there for lunch).

We didn’t see the cleaning crew until late afternoon, but assume that is due to staffing shortages.  

I can’t wait to visit again.

title: Great Stay; Avoid the Bar
text: Just finished a seven-night stay at the Chelsea.  Our stay was pleasant and the staff was outstanding, except for our two visits to the bar. Both nights we had the same bartender. The first night we were ignored for ten minutes as she seemed to be doing, well, nothing. We were finally served but in a very perfunctory manner. We decided to give it a second chance a couple of nights later. First, we found that the bar doesn't stock Jameson, which seems blasphemous. Then, the same bartender from the previous visit was unable to make several different cocktails - such as a Brandy Alexander - because she either didn't know how or didn't have the ingredients. The final straw came - and it is the only reason I am posting this - when the bartender said to my wife in a condescending tone, "Why don't you just read the menu." Of course, my wife had already gone over the cocktail menu several times at that point.  But, that was the only negative of our stay at the Chelsea. Everything else was wonderful. Just avoid the bar.

title: Beautiful Hotel for a Slice of NYC History
text: I had been dreaming about being in the Hotel Chelsea since reading 'Just Kids'. So much history in this building...Allen Ginsberg, Arthur Miller, Iggy Pop, Patti Smith, Edie Sedgwick...countless notable residents. This hotel is beautifully restored and has an amazing energy that is palpable as soon as you walk in the front doors. It's a slice of NYC history, and the hotel did not disappoint. We were upgraded to a gorgeous suite and all of our experiences were so special. The staff were friendly, the rooms and bathrooms were beautifully curated, and we did not want to leave! I lived in NYC for ten years before getting the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Chelsea and have recommended it to all of my friends. 10/10! Cannot wait to return. P.S. the Lobby Bar is excellent for drinks!

title: Fabulous hotel with spacious rooms!
text: The renovation at The Hotel Chelsea is a top notch.  Our room (5Q) was spacious with a large dressing area and bathroom.  We couldn't believe how quiet it was - we couldn't hear any road noise.  Check-in was fast and easy and front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  We will definitely return!

title: DIFFERENT
text:
We stayed for 3 nights, selecting the hotel because of its history and anticipated vibe. First impressions were a little disappointing; as we got out of our cab the doormen were unresponsive, and the reception staff were polite but not friendly. At 2.00pm our room was not yet ready (really? - no one seemed to check) so we explored the local streets and returned at 3.00pm, when it was. The lobby area is unfortunately small, quite dark and a bit depressing.  

Things improved dramatically when we stepped out of the lift on the 10th floor, bathed in light and just as we had imagined. Our room (Deluxe Atelier grade) was a large suite, eclectically and expensively furnished. The rugs in both the living and bedrooms were particularly stunning. All usual amenities for this grade - beautiful linen, towels and robes, Nespresso, a super king size bed, a large bathroom with a vintage-style bath and a large rain shower, a dressing room, a well stocked fridge and 2 smart TVs. Housekeeping  was efficient both during the day and in the evening, and when we got to know the doormen during our time there they were helpful and informative.

In summary a good stay and a different experience from the chintzy or the stylish minimalist which is the norm for New York upmarket hotels. And we were not disappointed by the eccentricity of some of our fellow guests. It’s not normal, but it is fun.

title: So much fun to stay here with all the history it contains.
text: Rooms are large and well appointed.  Beds are extremely comfortable.  Service is great and everyone is very helpful and friendly.  We will be back again and again and totally recommend anyone to stay here.  Chelsea is a great part of town with so much within walking distance.

title: It as great!
text: Chelsea Hotel is a very interesting building, especially because of its history but also because of what it is now.  NYC is my favorite town (I live in Amsterdam, a very nice town but actually more a village) and last April I was there for the 10th time (to be honest: in 50 years). On my gallery-walk in Chelsea I started with a coffee latte in the Chelsea Hotel. What a marvellous environment! Then, at the desk, I asked if I could have a tour of the hotel. They gave me the email adress of a employee, William Benton. A few days thereafter he offered me a wonderful tour of the hotel. He knows a lot of the history and could answer all my questions.   It was great!

Hotel Chelsea treated my mom to a weekend she will never forget on Mothers Day. Service was 10/10, upgraded room was spectacular, and no detail was left unlooked. Highly recommend for friends, family, and yourself.

title: I had a great experience at the Hotel Chelsea
text: I typically stay in midtown when traveling to New York, and had never stayed at the Chelsea.  I stayed four nights and had a great experience.  The staff was welcoming and professional without being White Lotus smarmy.  The room was unusual and unique, but very comfortable - laid out in the European model with a hall separating the bedroom from the hotel hallway.  My room was quiet and the highly styled (by my standards) furniture was comfortable and nicely done. I faced 23rd, and the french doors and heavy curtains meant that I wasn't bothered by street noise at night.  I ate breakfast every day and had dinner twice in the lobby bar, which is great: limited menu but good food and drinks and more good staff. I had some New York friends in for drinks one evening and they loved it.  It was a pleasure to stay in an unusual, historic hotel that seems to have been really throughtfully redeveloped.

title: This hotel is an experience. You feel like you’ve gone back in time.
text: The  room we stayed in was so romantic. We stepped through curtains and double doors out to a balcony that overlooked the street.  The attention to details and the retro design made the room very special. The bed was very comfortable.

title: Most iconic and beautiful hotel in New York city !
text:
Chelsea Hotel is the most iconic and beautiful hotel in New York.
Everything is perfect. Room is «chic», mattress and linen very confortable, bathroom has all you can dream of. All employes are polite. The cafe Chelsea offers a nice menu in a nice environment. 
Also, knowing you are at the same hotel Leonard Cohen and Janis Joplin met adds a magic touch !

title: Room spectacular, history beyond belief.
text:
Just spent 4 nights at the Chelsea Hotel and loved it! This hotel is filled with so much beauty and is an historical legend. The architecture is stunning with the internal metal staircase, the high ceilings, and the wood trim details everywhere. Upon entering at the lobby, you feel transported into a different time and place. Viewing the artwork on the walls (love it or not) from past residents makes real the many creative people who shared time here together. Walking down the central staircase displays the huge array of artwork and is like a vertical museum. 

Our room was exquisitely decorated in the period of the building with all the modern conveniences and in our case, a full kitchen and washer dryer! (Note: the gas is still not connected on the stove top due to permitting delays). The bed and bedding were perfect. 

The front desk was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. One area to be aware of... a glass of wine at the bar on the first floor can be pricey! The bartender recommended a white wine and the cost was $25 + tax and tip came to $30! I will definitely check the prices in advance next time! 

In summary, I recommend you read all about the Chelsea Hotel in advance of your stay to bring alive the incredible history of the building and the creative people who lived here. We will definitely return on our next visit to NYC!

title: Great Stay - Can't Wait to Return!
text: I have been wanting to stay at the historic Hotel Chelsea once I heard that it had reopened after its extensive renovations.  As I finally had a trip planned to NYC, I just had to stay there, and I had a wonderful experience from start to finish!  My balcony suite was beautiful, well-appointed and and very spacious!  Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable.  The bar was great too!  I really can't recommend this hotel enough, and I definitely look forward to staying here again!

title: Amazing NYC weekend in a historic hotel!
text:
We had a fabulous weekend at this hotel. I called the hotel twice before arriving - once to inquire about their fitness facility and the second the morning we were arriving to ask if it were possibly to have an early checkin. Both were helpful and pleasant. When we arrived, the gentleman at the front desk remembered my earlier call. We had our lunch in the bar (amazing burgers!) and our rooms were ready once we were finished and they had already arranged for our bags to be delivered upstairs. Additionally, they put our rooms down the same passage so we could be next door to each other and that small hall had a separate door to close off any noise from the main hall. 

Loved my room!! I booked a Chelsea room and it had a sitting room with a couch and coffee table, ample closet space, mini bar, safe, suitcase stand, extra towels and slippers. The bedroom had a king bed and beautiful fixtures including what appeared to be an old style radio. The alarm clock was also a phone charger. Incredibly comfortable mattress and bedding, perfect temperature with absolutely no street or hallway noise, it was two nights of some of the best sleep in a long time. The bathroom was spacious with robes and any toiletries one would need including toothpaste and the marble and brass was gorgeous. I had requested the Nespresso machine in room ahead of time and it was there upon arrival. 

They’ve done a beautiful job of upgrading the hotel while keeping a sense of its history. One of the long term residents lived across the hotel and we enjoyed a fantastic conversation with him when we were coming back Saturday afternoon. He gave us a tour of his apartment and talked of what it was like many years ago. Additionally, my friend was speaking to one of the staff members who gave him a walk of all the floors and the history of who stayed where. 

I can’t wait to come back - I’m planning to request the same room, I enjoyed it so much.

title: If you like NYC, add this stay to your bucket list
text: This is a must see/stay in NYC. The location. is Chelsea and very walkable with great food and coffee shops nearby. Stop in the Westside market and pick up some snacks so you don’t have to go more than a few minutes without eating in NYC. Then take the elevator to your room. We were in 10 E which blew us away from the moment we entered. Floor to ceiling windows in the living room, couch, chairs, table, modern mini-bar and a separate bedroom with (decorative) fireplace. Decor surpasses expectations. So refreshing from all gray or beige. (I would love to know where the area rugs are from.) Bathroom was huge with tub and shower and gold fixtures. Windows from bathroom to living room were odd, but made for great lighting in bathroom. Staff was lovely and added to a great stay.  Make sure to read up on the hotel’s history that you will become a part of if you choose The Hotel Chelsea for a stay!  Highly recommend.

title: Long live The Hotel Chelsea!
text:
This was my third time staying at The Chelsea since you re-opened, and each time just gets better and better. The people at the front desk could not have been more welcoming and courteous, and the three gentlemen at the main entrance during my stay were always efficient, welcoming and friendly. The hand-written note welcoming me back and complimentary bottles of water I found on the fireplace mantle in my room upon check-in were a superb touch. My room was extremely clean and comfortable and had all that I needed. And sitting one night at the bar in El Quijote, sipping a superbly crafted Martini and reminiscing was great. You have a done an incredible job with the renovations as well as polishing up this gem on West 23rd, all the while maintaining some of the old vibe and atmosphere. I look forward to returning for another visit. 
Peter A. Deysenroth, Cooperstown, NY

title: Perfect iconic stay
text:
When I found out that the hotel that I took pictures of the plaques in front of a few years ago was reopening I knew I was going to try to stay there and it happened last week.
Walking in the lobby is like walking back in time. I definitely knew the importance of walking in the hotel where Leonard Cohen, Andy Warhol, Arthur Miller have stayed, to name a few, gave me chills.
The details are exquisite, from the fireplace to the couches to the mail slots behind the front desk and the keys that open the doors.
I had arrived early and was happy when they cleared a room for me 2 hours before check in time.
The corridors are clean and small but smell good.
My room was small (petite queen) but so well decorated with such attention to details that I loved it. The bed was firm, just the way I like it. There was plenty of electrical plugs close to the bed (I usually find that there is not enough in hotel rooms).
The water pressure in the shower was very nice with a rain shower head. I also appreciated the lighting next to the mirror.
The closet had everything I could need from the minibar, to large soft towels, to enough hangers and much more.
As for the staff, what can I say, every staff member I came in contact with from the person at the door, to the staff at the front desk to the host/hostess at the lobby bar were so very nice, courteous and ready to help.
I go to New York often and so far this has been my best hotel experience.

title: Perfect
text:
I loved the way the Chelsea Hotel is giving low-key reverence for the past without sentimentality. On one hand, it’s obviously iconic for those who know, but on the other hand it’s also a beautifully unfussy Sean MacPherson property that’s making the space relevant for new generations who don’t care who Lou Reed is.

I stayed with my 6 year old daughter and we loved both sides of the hotel. Our room was beautiful, spotless, and smelled great. The bathroom was small and efficient with an excellent shower. When we closed the balcony doors, all the street noise vanished. In fact it was one of the quietest rooms I’ve stayed in—except for the neighbor we heard practicing opera one night, which, we’re at the Chelsea Hotel so it was perfect. The rooms and public spaces were serene but also authentic—a hard balance.

Staff was excellent, especially Mike who graciously made friends with a stuffed skunk.

We loved breakfast and we loved the lobby bar for ice-cream at night. 

Thanks for having us—we look forward to coming back soon.

title: Beautiful venue steeped in history (great cocktails)
text: Beautiful Hotel steeped in history and pop culture. Wonderful cocktails (the Edie is a standout) in the lobby bar. Stephen from Derry was a wonderful host, the service was impeccable. THANK YOU Stephen we will return.

title: Only 35 reviews - Avoid this tourist trap at all costs.
text: Avoid at all costs. Firstly, note that while the star rating is high, I missed the fact that there are only 35 reviews. The hotel is old, dingy, smells of mold, and there was a homeless man passed out on the lobby as I walked in to check in. That should've been my first warning sign. They charge 4-star hotel rates ($500/night) but the experience is anything but. It was worse than checking into a motel. I spent 2 minutes in my room and decided to check out immediately. Unfortunately the Manager (Tasha) was incredibly pretentious, condescending and room and insisted on charging me for the night. There are so many incredible hotels in New York especially at this price point. Avoid this tourist trap at all costs.

title: Sleep in history
text: Come for the history, stay for the...everything. The lovely, unintrusive staff. The old-school charm combined with modern conveniences. The rooms are comfortable, with a perfect combination of classic fixtures and charming updates. The room bar is fantastically appointed, and the tub (not all rooms have tubs) is European length. After a perfect night of delicious cocktails downstairs, enjoying quiet conversation, hit the button to close the blackout curtains and drift away. I can't wait to come back - I'm checking prices now.

title: I loved it SO much!!!
text:
I absolutely loved The hotel Chelsea and the entire experience! They helped us to celebrate a milestone 60th birthday with every single special treat that you could imagine a hotel to do-without even asking! 
I felt, safe, cared for and truly important here. Everyone really went above and beyond from the absolutely perfect door staff to the amazing host at the restaurant. 
The room was a suite. Had a fabulous sitting area with a couch and 2 chairs. So comfortable, clean and new!!
The bathroom huge-a bathtub and a beautiful shower. Bath salts for the tub, old fashioned adorable toothpaste. I took a video and sent it to all my friends and family because I was amazed and it’s an NYC hotel!! :))
The pillows were even great and you can’t find that anymore! Ever!
I almost hate to give this great review because I don’t want to share. Lol!! And I can’t wait to go back!! Lol!!!
But it’s worth it, for sure! They deserve the recognition, it’s the least I could do for our experience and how well we were treated! I intended to send a personal thank you note but just haven’t gotten to it. 
A million stars!! Go-you won’t regret it. And eat at Mels (close by) if you can too! Amazing!!!

title: Very clean rooms. Very unpleasant staff.
text: Super clean rooms, great history, EXCEPTIONALLY UNFRIENDLY STAFF. Like they cannot be bothered. Restaurants are sub par. $7 for a cup of coffee at breakfast and it was cold. Was told they were brewing more and it took about 20+ min. The property could do more to share about the history and art. When asked staff on different occasions (and different staff members) they knew nothing. And could barely make eye contact. Your biggest selling point is getting completely left behind. Ultimately this place just isn’t ready and based on what we experienced likely never will be.

title: I wish we could have stayed longer
text:
Our stay at The Hotel Chelsea was mesmerising . There is no other way to describe it. For those familiar with the history of the building – it remains a living and immersive tribute to a bygone area. No other destination in New York can match its uniqueness. 

Not only has the hotel stayed true to its roots since its re-opening but its current reincarnation is nothing short of remarkable. Everything from the furnishings through to the art was exceptional. The moment you enter the building there is a ‘feeling’ you get - that you are walking into something special, something historic.  

The customer service was exceptional. Every member of staff was attentive and really made you feel at home.  A very special mention to Alexis at reception and Jacob in the breakfast room. They really went out of there way to add to the experience – thank you both. 

Alex & Naty

title: A GEM!
text: As soon as I stepped foot in this hotel, I knew it would be a special stay.  The door man, Michael, immediately made us feel at home with his warm welcome and most helpful demeanor. Our suite, was nothing short of exquisite. From the lighting fixtures to the nightstand tables, down to the unique bluetooth speaker, the thought and attention to every lux detail was not missed.  Beyond the suite walls, was our second home- the Lobby Bar. Not only are the renovations beautiful, but they managed to keep the integrity and artistic history of this hotel.  In addition to the beauty of the lobby bar, Courtney (the host) and Claire (the sommelier) are one of the warmest and most fabulous people. Being there truly makes you feel like you are part of something special.  In the words of Patti Smith, "...with a hundred rooms, each a small universe". I am hoping to be back to this home away from home as soon as possible.

title: Can't wait to return!
text:
What a special place. My husband and I had stopped in at the lobby during our visit last year to NYC to see our daughter, and were greeted so warmly and loved the interior decor so much we decided to give it a try for our next visit to her. 

We were lucky enough to score a luxury suite - GINORMOUS! So beautiful! A fully appointed and spectacular kitchen, newly renovated huge bathrooms - what a great shower!!! Between the suite and the fabulous bar downstairs, it was hard to have to leave the hotel to go see New York! A real treat to be spoiled this way, and a stay we won't soon forget. Thank you so much to the young man who checked us in Saturday afternoon! So friendly and helpful - I'm sorry I didn't get your name!

Thank you also to Michael, also at the desk, who very kindly and graciously helped us switch rooms when we had an electrical problem in our first.

We had breakfast one of the days in the beautiful bar area. Such a pretty setting, and the food and service were great, too.

The hotel allows dogs, which makes the lobby a very fun place to pass through! 

Can't imagine staying anywhere else next time we visit our daughter!

title: Hotel  Chelsea EXCEEDED My Very High  Expectations
text:
For years I have imagined myself staying at the Chelsea Hotel and this past week I achieved that dream

I grew up listening to Leonard Cohen and Joni Mitchell and reading multiple articles, books and blogs on the hotel. 

11 years ago, our daughter moved to the Chelsea neighborhood and every time I passed by, I said “some day…”  

That day finally happened this past week after retiring from my job of 40+ years

It did not disappoint. Both my husband and I agreed it is by far our favorite over the multiple Chelsea hotels we’ve stayed in over the past decade

The (most recent!) developers maintained the charm and character while updating amenities that we require in the 21st century

When you walk into the hotel after being greeted by the doorman, you are welcomed by smiling faces at that iconic front desk framed by the spectacular staircase adorned on every floor by the art work of early tenants of the hotel

The rooms have such beautiful touches like the antique-designed closets, the window table and the beautiful wood floors with the hotel logo subtly engrained

The bathroom is spacious (by NYC standards) and again provides interesting and comfort design touches

I’ll stop here
I’m still savoring our stay and still reading books on the hotel

Thank you Hotel Chelsea
Sally K from NH

title: Wonderful anniversary weekend stay
text: I took my wife here for our anniversary here and the hotel was wonderful. We first heard about The Chelsea from recent CBS Sunday Morning story. It's historic, beautiful, incredible bar, and staff was helpful & friendly. The General Manager Duke even treated us with a bottle of wine when we met him. I recommend it highly.

title: Gorgeous new and stylish hotel
text:
I stayed at The Hotel Chelsea for 3 nights while on a business trip to NYC. Very satisfied with the overall experience.
The hotel has been recently renovated and is gorgeous. The staff was particularly friendly everywhere, from reception to the bar, room service etc. 
The rooms are large for NYC and very clean. The bathrooms are beautiful and great views from the balconies.
The breakfast options were decent, quite overpriced but takeaway drip coffee is FOC. 

As it’s a new hotel some elements need fine tuning. The corridors need better interior design - they’re very large and empty. 
No coffee machines in the rooms - this is a big issue considering the nightly rate. Even a kettle would be helpful… 
The gym was under renovation still - this will be a great add on when it opens.
The hotel is on 23rd St, a large street which is always busy. It can get noisy even late at night.

title: Sid and Nancy
text:
It was so awesome staying in this Hotel Sid and Nancy died in Room 100, corridors look the same just restored and more . That is the reason I stayed a couple of nights. 
I would stay in this location as it is close to transportation in New York City.
Wicked

title: Boutique Hotel with a Historic Rock-n-Roll Vibe.
text:
The Hotel Chelsea, for more than a century, has been destination hot-spot for celebrities, rock and rollers and the high and mighty. This landmark building, recently opened after 11 years of closure, is now a luxury boutique hotel.

I relished my Premier Balcony room with wrought iron balcony overlooking West 23rd Street. The chamber was bright and airy with an original fireplace and stained glass. An animal print chair was funky item, no doubt in keeping with the ambience of the hotel. The bath was marbleized with brass fixtures and a deep soaking tub.

The goto restaurant in the Chelsea is the El Quijote known for its Spanish classics, the likes of tuna, beef cheeks and others, but my fav was squid and blood sausage washed down with red sangria. Rumour has it that Jimmy Hendrix, Janis Joplin and other musicians had a meal here before driving to Woodstock. I wonder what they talked about.

So, for totally unique accommodations, embedded with a rock-and-roll spirit from the past.........then try the ......Hotel Chelsea.....Boutique Hotel with a Historic Rock-n-Roll Vibe.

title: Terrible start, comfy bed
text: The decor, location, bed, vibe…all great.  HOWEVER, the visits started us off really irked.   We were put in a lower category room ( facing a wall, 250sq ft, no side table) than i booked and paid for.    When i called them out on it, they “transferred me to a manager” only to hang up on me, and when I finally reached someone, they told me I was wrong.  I 100% wasn’t.  Once shown the proper category room -   They again tried to make it seem like they were doing me a favor when i was simply trying to get what i had paid for.    Plus l, the keys repeatedly didn’t work.  No acknowledgement of or apology for our inconvenience, their deception/mistake, or the loss of an entire half hour dealing with the situation.

title: Great experience, amazingly historic hotel
text: What a wonderful experience! Upon arrival we walked through a cozy living room lobby to a charming front desk with a wall of tassel keys. You could see all the way up the winding staircase above the desk to the top skylight roof. Our room was better than expected with 3 sets antique glass doors that led to a catwalk balcony.  So many antique details made this hotel unique and beautiful. Staff were warm and friendly and genuinely kind to us and our 7 yr old daughter. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Loud loud noise every week at night
text: Horrible experience! They had oil truck came at 1:30am to suck the grease for the restaurant downstairs. The loud noise lasted 33mins and worst it came every Friday morning. So the bottom line is don’t spend Thursday night.

title: If the Chelsea is for you, don't miss it!
text: My wife and I stayed 5 nights in November 2022. The Hotel Chelsea is wonderfully eclectic and charming.  It has a storied history which is worth checking out on Wikipedia. One example from our stay, we were jus a few doors down from the room Janis Joplin lived in. We loved the Chelsea's location with subway stations a half block away in either direction, and easy walking distance to many of the most interesting areas and neighborhoods in New York.  The accommodations themselves are great.  Very comfortable bed, very spacious room by NYC standards, wonderful bath and shower. Our room also came with breakfast included which mat not still be available, but if it is, I would recommend adding it, it was so delicious.  The staff were excellent to work with, as was the room service, and the bar is incredible. Its rare for us that the place we stay is one of the best memories of a trip, but the Hotel Chelsea is for us.

title: The Return of an Icon
text: After a lifetime of reading about this legendary property we finally had the opportunity to visit. The newly renovated rooms highlight the respect and love the hotel has for the building and its history. The spaces are comfortable, full of personality, yet surprisingly modern. The massive bathtub connected to the living room was a fun detail and the balcony let us take in all of New York City's energy. At the same time, once we wanted to rest, closing the windows created a little sanctuary in the middle of Chelsea. The front desk and Quijote staff were the friendliest, and I would definitely recommend coming down for a drink at the bar and then jumping over for some paella and pan con tomate! Can't recommend it enough!

title: Outstanding experience.
text: Absolutely First Class all the way. Staff were wonderful and accommodating, The decor was really cool and let a kind of retro ambiance that made it a truly magical experience. House restaurant was really exquisite. I would whole heartedly recommend this to anyone. I will definitely be coming back.

title: Worthwhile just for a drink
text: Wanted to visit this historic place and couldn't possibly afford to stay so had a drink in the bar. Very expensive compared to the rest of our budget trip but a totally worthwhile experience. It was very busy, filled with ' bright young things', the wait list for just a drink was 90 minutes but the gorgeous staff managed to find us a spot at the bar. Really enjoyed my $22 margarita- sipped very slowly to maximise  the precious sense of those who had sat there before me.

title: Give the Chelsea a few months.
text:
What a disappointment the Hotel Chelsea was. We arrived after a 2 week trip to Europe, looking forward to nice retreat in the city. When we arrived, there was no one to help with our luggage and we were placed on the backside of the hotel, after asking for a city view. Neither 1 of the doormen made us feel welcome, not like attendants in the reception. 
The cocktails were crazy expensive and the service in the bar was poor. I believe we arrived in between shifts, but it still took quite a while before we received service. The service for breakfast in the other hand was superb, never mind we paid $22.00 for a plate of mediocre scrambled eggs.
I will  say the accommodations in the room very  nice. I would suggest restocking the complimentary water, daily, though. The Nespresso machine was lovely, but we had to move it to a wall that had an electrical outlet.  Poor planning !
I would wait a month or so to try this hotel until they get the kinks worked out.

title: A dreamy hotel
text:
I had been longing to visit the renewed Chelsea Hotel, having been around for some of its bohemian heyday and its sad decline.  Can say that all of the work and money and aesthetic travail that have been poured into the Chelsea was worth it.  It’s truly beautiful.

I spent one night night in a tenth floor room facing 23rd Street.  It was quiet, no noise from the street or the hall.  The bed and linens were comfortable;  the bathtub was magnificent, no problem filling it with nice hot water; there was a Nespresso machine and an imaginatively stocked minibar. For me, the real delight was in the style: green velvet portieres, wallpaper with dainty maidens and garlands, little side chairs with tiger stripes.  It’s not the Chelsea of Leonard Cohen, but it’s a really, really beautiful old lady with very good taste.

Everyone I ran into, at check-in, housekeeping, the waiter who brought up my perfect club sandwich, was courteous, charming and/or welcoming, as appropriate.  Looking forward to my next stay.

title: Not quite up to the hype
text:
We had 3 rooms for 8 nights.

They certainly had guts taking on this huge and formerly decrepit monster, and having stayed at The Bowery last time we were in NYC (that shares some ownership), period fakery is their forte. There is little to no originality left room-wise, though the public spaces retain a great deal. Generic it is not, which along with its history, is its main USP. 

The rooms are a decent size (for NYC anyhow), but the basic room shares the same huge kingsize bed as the others, which takes up the vast majority of the space. I had a Chelsea King with tub, and it was lacking in too many areas. Some are standard shortfalls in American hotels, like the lack of decent lighting. Impossible to read in bed. Illogical light switch layout. Serious lack of clothes storage. No large drawers at all, so I lived out of my case for the duration. No stand for the case either. No beverage facilities in the room, which I always think is downright mean. 

It is also very much work-in-progress. Some of the issues we experienced:

The hot water was a murky grey. Once run, the tub did not look very welcoming. Very hard, and no bath salts to soften it. I mentioned this on the first day. The guy said it shouldn't be like this and would send up an engineer, but this was never something that was going to sorted in a couple of days. And it wasn't.

Instead of printed holders for the key-card, the room number was written on in metallic sharpie, which rubbed off on my partner's treasured wallet when in his pocket.

On return after a night out, my partner had no power at all in his room. They found another room for him to sleep in, and it was restored in the morning. They comped the night and gave us $75 credit in the bar - which we appreciated.

I returned to find my AC off with an error code. The control was unresponsive, so I had a stuffy night. It came on of its own accord the next morning.

I had 2 very small cartons of water in my room, which were drunk and not replaced for the duration.

We all had problems with intermittent hot water in the showers, and why they had to put such a big step into the shower I know not. Could easily have been a walk-in.

We understand that it's on a semi soft opening, and that teething troubles are inevitable, but the question comes as to what one should expect from a $625 a night room. They may be "preview" rates, but they're hardly a bargain. Whilst they give nothing away in the rooms (and the smellies were pretty lo-rent - nothing like as nice as The Bowery), they do provide a basic Continental Breakfast in the main bar. It's more than usually provided, but there's something a bit begrudging about it. Croissants, scones, three types of berries and yoghurt. Self serve (weak) coffee, and bizzarely, a sole electric kettle that has to be asked to be filled, then boiled by customers wanting tea. No fruit juice and not even iced water (again, on request). The room is wonderful, but freezing cold and with zero atmosphere. Like eating in a library. Put some cool music on, please. 

There's plenty to like. The art is great, as is the general taste of the refurb. Staff were mainly very helpful, with a special shout out to the ever cheerful Jake (who should be modelling, really) and William, who has great knowledge and passion for the building. I'm glad we stayed. It's a special place with a special vibe. I'm not likely to be returning, as the rates will go up and no doubt to more than I'm willing to pay. This place will need forever maintenance, as we say in the UK, like the Forth Bridge. Once finished, it will need starting again. Whether they can provide the experience than justifies even higher prices remains to be seen. It's certainly not "average" in itself, but I can't give it more than 3 stars.

title: Le seul et l’unique
text: Quel bonheur d’avoir enfin pu séjourner dans cet endroit mythique du XX siècle où tant d’artistes ont vécu. La rénovation a  été menée de façon spectaculaire et l’âme du lieu est toujours intacte. Certains anciens locataires vivent d’ailleurs toujours ici et nous avons pu en croiser quelques-uns. Une étoile en moins cependant pour le service: accueil glacial, attribution d’un faux numéro de chambre, plus d’eau chaude pour se doucher, café servi froid… Le restaurant El Quijote et son ambiance survoltée est cependant incontournable.

title: Beautifully restored hotel
text: We had a fantastic stay at this historic hotel. It was on soft opening so I’m going to go easy on the service which did lack in some areas. There is a grumpy old fellow in breakfast service that shouldn’t be there and a couple of requests for ice during our stay never eventuated. But the hotel is beautifully restored and the rooms are extremely spacious for NYC and I thought the price was more than reasonable also. I would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Wanted to like the new reno, was worried I wouldn’t, but I loved it !
text: I had not been to the Hotel Chelsea in 20 years.  I have a kindred connection to this property.  I like many waited patiently for its reno to be completed for the last 15 years.  I wanted to like it, I was worried I wouldn’t; but I really do love it.  They have brought back its original charm, didn’t try to make it something it wasn’t or isn’t.  The new hotel blends well with the long term residents and the new bar/restaurant expanded space is first class.

title: Beautifully updated
text:
Beautifully appointed. Stayed for 4 nights in 6f, which is a small studio king room. The bathroom is spacious and the shower’s water pressure is nice along with the hot water. Lighting was nice but not tons of natural light because it looks into an interior courtyard. Does not have a seating area or table.

Breakfast was included and is hosted in the lobby bar with plenty of seating and morning papers. Fresh berries, croissants, yogurt, milk, tea, and coffee.

The lobby itself is a bit of a thoroughfare, but the lobby bar is a restful place to sit.

I toured one of the one bedroom pied a tierre rooms - it was spacious and overlooked 23rd.

Hotel service overall was nice and prompt. Some visible construction still going on but not disruptive at all.

title: Iconic Hotel / Perfect stay!
text: We loved it!! Our rooms were wonderful -  we had an amazing balcony overlooking the street with views forever!  The remodel was thoughtfully  done - new and updated yet still  keeping the original architectural details. The staff was lovely and we enjoyed Speaking with michael as we checked out!  Couldn’t recommend the Chelsea enough!

title: The times have changed
text:
After my second stay and Im still not sure I will return after the rates go up. The staff was great and the bar was mostly fun. The prices are attracting a not typical Chelsea clientele which is expected but these people looked like they were dressed for a golf tournament. Of course I miss a lot about old NY so I will skip a lot of gripes because they would apply to the city overall. 
But Its weird to hang out in the lobby or bar when it feels like a library and everybody is afraid to talk very loud until they drink enough to not care. My rooms have been nice and have a timeless feel. I hope people who feel it is a meaningful and important place will be able to afford some of the room types. Rather than just the dbags and rich kidults that they are likely trying to cater to. Lobby William was an encyclopedia and very sincere in his love for the hotels history and tenants, even finding a positive slant on my take (gripe) on how lame NY's creative cla$$ currently is. His warmth and sincerity was appreciated by a few people I talked to. Cedrick was very helpful and kind. The bar staff also. 
I hope we can meet in the middle Chelsea Hotel.

title: Utter class from superb staff
text:
I didn’t stay here, but my adult sons and I popped in for a drink in the bar, as I’m a big Leonard Cohen fan, and this is an iconic venue.
We received a genuine and very warm reception, and then entered the stunning bar area where we we were met by the lovely bartender who served us our drinks (at a reasonable price, I might add).
After our drinks, I cheekily asked if there was any way to look around, given the history of the place.
Minutes later we had a printed room history in hand, and were shown around by the lovely Jake. He was cool, friendly and knowledgeable.
It was a great experience. Places with true class are unpretentious, treat people with great respect, and are a pleasure to visit. Hotel Chelsea is one such place.
If I ever come into money, I know where I’ll be staying next time I visit New York.
The wall art is stunning, by the way…
Thanks everyone for a great afternoon 😊

title: Mixed feelings on this one
text:
I have mixed feelings about this hotel and there are a few reasons why:

Some Pros 
- Cute (small room) 
- Great Sheets & Bed 
- Slept well
- Very cute bar for an evening drink

Cons 
- I am not a fan of this area and the street the hotel is on. It’s very busy and just not great. It’s a bit “no man’s land”
- August 16 - they are still not finished. There are workmen around / and many floors are still under construction. I got a “discounted” rate but I would not pay more even if they were finished. 
- The hotel has a strange energy. I can’t quite put my finger on it…. I think it feels more like an apartment building than hotel - Reasons for saying this : staff were lovely but had a very unprofessional feel to them. Feel more like doorman? Also When eating breakfast in the morning the staff just stand around talking very informally. At one point they were discussing how they hope there won’t be table service for breakfast as they didn’t want to serve. Thought that was strange in front of a guest. 
- Corridors have other apartments on them / and their normal doors. They say very boldly “Tenant Occupied”. I also smelt gross cooking smells 

If it’s your first time going to NYC I would not recommend this hotel. I would look elsewhere as much better options out there for the price. 

I would only recommend this spot if you need to be in this neighbourhood and no other options. Or if you have nostalgia about this hotel.

title: Amazing Re-Birth of a Cultural Landmark
text:
It had been a dream of mine to stay at the Hotel Chelsea to savor its rich history and that dream more than came true last night. Finally open once again to hotel guests after many years, the hotel positively radiates warmth, charm and history. The decor and furnishings are plush, the renovated rooms are huge and the newly opened lobby bar is gorgeous and welcoming; They even serve a tasty continental breakfast along the bar top! 

Finally, the staff is amazing. In particular, I have to salute William, who greeted me when I arrived and at my urging shared just a bit of his knowledge of the history of this amazing hotel.

I cannot wait to visit the Hotel Chelsea again on my next trip to NY and highly urge others to do the same.

title: Your Staying in History
text: There are few hotels that can offer so much pop culture history from famous writers to dramatic deaths.  This hotel has done a credible job with its redo.  Even the lobby is a blast to the past with paintings adorning the walls.  You will also find period furniture and a special lobby bar.

title: The best experience ever
text: My Mother and I absolutely loved our experience at the Hotel Chelsea. We travel quite a bit but this hotel is now our favorite place. The history, decor, architecture and most importantly the staff were amazing

title: Beautiful and full of charm
text: Great and very friendly staff. Attention to detail in the guest rooms is immaculate. Extremely comfortable bed and furniture in addition to being beautiful and full of character. The bathroom is gorgeous and very spacious. Simply loved it and enjoyed my stay. Very unique hotel.

title: Wonderful renovation!
text:
Beautifully appointed and spacious for an historic hotel.
Enjoyed the artwork throughout.
Love the Bold rich colors. The lobby is comfortable and inviting with historically appropriate scale furniture decorated with wonderful samples from the artists who called the Hotel Chelsea home.
Event space is extraordinary… Bravo!

title: Perfection
text:
I am on the last night of my ten day stay at the Hotel Chelsea. Giving reviews is not something I really do but my experience has moved me to write this tonight before I leave tomorrow morning. 
The Hotel Chelsea is perfect in every way.
My room has very high ceilings with crown molding like cake icing. There is a decadent marble bathroom with a grand tub so lovely that I took a bath every night. My room is decorated with such deep style as only the legendary Sean MacPherson knows how to create.
Velvety Art Deco carpets, a lusciously chubby mohair sofa and a Victorian bed that I considered shoving into my suitcase, I wanted for nothing during my stay. The staff is exceptional. In all my comings and goings, I met them all from housekeeping to the front desk even one brave man who was navigating the scaffolding on the façade of the building on the 10th floor outside my window. All of them willing to go out of their way to make my experience better. 
There are not enough stars in the rating system to reflect the score I give this hotel.
It is excellent.
